name: abolish
trans: vt. 废除，废止；取消，革除

sentences.english: Slavery was abolished in the US in the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 美国于19世纪废除了奴隶制。

detailed_translations.english: to officially end a law, system etc, especially one that has existed for a long time

name: ridiculous
trans: adj. 可笑的；荒谬的

sentences.english: That’s a ridiculous idea!
sentences.chinese: 那主意很荒唐！

sentences.english: Don’t be ridiculous!
sentences.chinese: 别傻了！

sentences.english: I’d look ridiculous in a dress like that.
sentences.chinese: 我穿那样的裙子会显得很可笑。

detailed_translations.english: very silly or unreasonable

name: summary
trans: n. 概要，摘要，总结

sentences.english: A brief summary is given on a separate sheet.
sentences.chinese: 摘要另写一页。

sentences.english: It says torture and summary execution are common.
sentences.chinese: 据说酷刑和草草处决很常见。

detailed_translations.english: a short statement that gives the main information about something, without giving all the details
a summary report, statement etc gives the main facts in a report etc without any of the details or explanations

name: formation
trans: n. 形成；构造；编队

sentences.english: We now know a lot more about the early stages of planetary formation.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在对行星形成过程的早期阶段有了更多的了解。

sentences.english: the formation of a new government
sentences.chinese: 新政府的组成

sentences.english: the canyon’s impressive rock formations
sentences.chinese: 峡谷中壮观的岩层

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something develops into a particular thing or shape

name: divergent
trans: adj. 相异的，分歧的；散开的

sentences.english: Two people who have divergent views on this question are George Watt and Bob Marr.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上意见相左的两个人是乔治·瓦特和鲍勃·马尔。

detailed_translations.english: Divergent things are different from each other

name: mathematics
trans: n. 数学；数学运算

sentences.english: ...a professor of mathematics at Boston College.
sentences.chinese: …一位波士顿大学的数学教授。

detailed_translations.english: the science of numbers and of shapes, including  algebra  ,  geometry  , and  arithmetic

name: mislead
trans: vt. 误导；带错

sentences.english: Don’t be misled by appearances, he’s a good worker.
sentences.chinese: 不要被表象迷惑，他工作干得挺不错的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone believe something that is not true by giving them information that is false or not complete

name: rhetorical
trans: adj. 修辞的；修辞学的；夸张的

sentences.english: a speech full of rhetorical phrases
sentences.chinese: 充满华丽辞藻的演讲

detailed_translations.chinese: 修辞的；修辞学的；夸张的
detailed_translations.english: using speech or writing in special ways in order to persuade people or to produce an impressive effect

name: indigenous
trans: adj. 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的

sentences.english: the many indigenous cultures which existed in Siberia
sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的
detailed_translations.english: indigenous people or things have always been in the place where they are, rather than being brought there from somewhere else

name: formidable
trans: adj. 强大的；可怕的；令人敬畏的；艰难的

sentences.english: The building is grey, formidable, not at all picturesque.
sentences.chinese: 那幢建筑呈灰色，气势凛然，与漂亮沾不上边。

sentences.english: The new range of computers have formidable processing power.
sentences.chinese: 该系列的新型计算机处理能力惊人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕的；令人敬畏的，令人惊叹的
detailed_translations.english: very powerful or impressive, and often frightening

name: Himalaya
trans: 喜马拉雅山脉

sentences.english: From the deck of a ship, the island makes a startling apparition, like the Himalaya just emerged from the Flood.
sentences.chinese: 坐船从甲板上看，这个岛屿简直是个惊人的神迹，就像喜马拉雅山在一片洪水中耸立。

sentences.english: Two men wrestle during a festival in Himachal Pradesh, which means “region of snowy mountains.” This resort area in the foothills of the Himalaya is an Indian favorite.
sentences.chinese: 喜马偕尔-布拉代什（意为雪山地区）庆祝活动期间，两名男子在摔跤。这是印度人最喜爱的在喜马拉雅山脚下度假的地方。

sentences.english: In the northwest, where human settlements are highly dependent on snowmelt in the Himalaya and Tianshan Mountains, temperature increase would mean disappearance of the oasis agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 在西北地区，人们的生活极度依赖喜马拉雅山和天山的融雪，气温上升将意味着那里的绿洲农业将消失。

name: Utopian
trans: n. 空想家；乌托邦的居民

sentences.english: His was a utopian vision of nature in its purest form.
sentences.chinese: 他对大自然的看法是一种最纯粹的乌托邦式看法。

detailed_translations.english: Utopian is used to describe political or religious philosophies which claim that it is possible to build a new and perfect society in which everyone is happy

name: astrophysical
trans: 天体物理学

name: confusion
trans: n. 混淆，混乱；困惑

sentences.english: a scene of indescribable confusion
sentences.chinese: 难以形容的混乱场面

sentences.english: To avoid confusion, the teams wore different colours.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免混淆，各队穿着不同颜色的服装。

detailed_translations.english: a very confusing situation, that usually has a lot of noise and action, so that it is difficult for someone to understand it or control it

name: precision
trans: n. 精度，[数] 精密度；精确

sentences.english: precision engineering
sentences.chinese: 精密工程

sentences.english: precision bombing
sentences.chinese: 精确轰炸

detailed_translations.chinese: 精度，[数] 精密度；精确
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very exact or correct
made or done in a very exact way

name: cautionary
trans: adj. 警告的；劝诫的

sentences.english: Barely fifteen months later, it has become a cautionary tale of the pitfalls of international mergers and acquisitions.
sentences.chinese: 15个月刚过，这便成了一个有关国际并购陷阱的警世故事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劝人谨慎的， 警戒的
detailed_translations.english: giving a warning about what not to do

name: cholesterol
trans: n. [生化] 胆固醇

sentences.english: So why would you want to lower your cholesterol?
sentences.chinese: 那么为什么你想降低你的胆固醇呢？

sentences.english: If it does, you should discuss with your physician other approaches to cholesterol control.
sentences.chinese: 若确实如此，您应该与您的医生讨论其他控制胆固醇方法。

sentences.english: "In order to prevent this oxidation of cholesterol, we need to consume antioxidants, preferably natural antioxidants that you get from fruits and vegetables, " he said in an interview.
sentences.chinese: “为了防止这种胆固醇氧化，我们需要消耗抗氧化剂，最好是从水果和蔬菜得到的天然抗氧化剂， ”他在接受采访时说道。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance found in your blood. Too much cholesterol in your body may cause heart disease.

name: get rid
trans: 摆脱；排除；处理掉

name: accent
trans: n. 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号

sentences.english: He had a strong Irish accent
sentences.chinese: 他有浓重的爱尔兰口音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号
detailed_translations.english: the way someone pronounces the words of a language, showing which country or which part of a country they come from
to make something more noticeable so that people will pay attention to it

name: qualifier
trans: n. [语] 修饰语

detailed_translations.english: a word or phrase that limits or adds to the meaning of another word or phrase

name: civilization
trans: n. 文明；文化

sentences.english: modern American civilization
sentences.chinese: 现代美国文明

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Greece and Rome
sentences.chinese: 希腊和罗马的古代文明

detailed_translations.english: a society that is well organized and developed, used especially about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time

name: thunder
trans: n. 雷；轰隆声；恐吓

sentences.english: We were woken in the night by thunder.
sentences.chinese: 晚上我们被雷声惊醒。

detailed_translations.english: the loud noise that you hear during a storm, usually after a flash of lightning
if it thunders, there is a loud noise in the sky, usually after a flash of lightning
to make a very loud deep noise

name: monument
trans: n. 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品

sentences.english: He erected a monument on the spot where his daughter was killed.
sentences.chinese: 他在女儿遇难的地方立了块纪念碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品
detailed_translations.english: a building,  statue  , or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person

name: talkative
trans: adj. 饶舌的；多话的；多嘴的；爱说话的

sentences.english: He suddenly became very talkative, his face slightly flushed, his eyes much brighter.
sentences.chinese: 他突然变得很爱说话，他的脸颊稍微有点红，他的眼睛明亮多了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 饶舌的；多话的；多嘴的；爱说话的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is talkative talks a lot

name: productivity
trans: n. 生产力；生产率；生产能力

sentences.english: high productivity levels in manufacturing
sentences.chinese: 制造业中的高生产率

sentences.english: It cost the country $4 million in lost productivity .
sentences.chinese: 它对该国造成了400万美元的生产力损失。

detailed_translations.english: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, especially in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them

name: extract
trans: n. 汁；摘录；榨出物；选粹

sentences.english: You’ll have to have that tooth extracted.
sentences.chinese: 你得把那颗牙拔掉。

sentences.english: Oils are extracted from the plants.
sentences.chinese: 从这些植物中提炼出油。

sentences.english: I’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
sentences.chinese: 我只是看过那部电影的一些小片段。

detailed_translations.english: to remove an object from somewhere, especially with difficulty
a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

name: mosquito
trans: n. 蚊子

sentences.english: The male mosquito never stings.
sentences.chinese: 雄蚊不叮。

sentences.english: Are your mosquito bites still itching?
sentences.chinese: 你被蚊子咬的地方还痒吗?

sentences.english: The frog darted out its tongue to catch a mosquito.
sentences.chinese: 这只青蛙突然伸出舌头捕捉蚊子。

detailed_translations.english: a small flying insect that sucks the blood of people and animals, sometimes spreading the disease  malaria

name: contraction
trans: n. 收缩，紧缩；缩写式；害病

sentences.english: the contraction of metal as it cools
sentences.chinese: 金属冷却时的收缩

detailed_translations.english: a very strong and painful movement of a muscle, especially the muscles around the  womb  during birth

name: goddess
trans: n. 女神，受崇拜的女性

sentences.english: Aphrodite, goddess of love
sentences.chinese: 爱神阿佛洛狄忒

detailed_translations.english: a female being who is believed to control the world or part of it, or represents a particular quality

name: geothermal
trans: adj. [地物] 地热的；[地物] 地温的

sentences.english: a geothermal energy plant
sentences.chinese: 地热能工厂

detailed_translations.english: relating to or coming from the heat inside the Earth

name: embrace
trans: n. 拥抱

sentences.english: We hope these regions will embrace democratic reforms.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望这些地区会乐意接受民主改革。

sentences.english: Most West European countries have embraced the concept of high-speed rail networks with enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 大多数西欧国家都表现出极大的兴趣，欣然接受修建高速铁路网的想法。

detailed_translations.english: to eagerly accept a new idea, opinion, religion etc

name: dissemination
trans: n. 宣传；散播；传染（病毒）

sentences.english: He had their own uniqueness and vitality, and dissemination of a value concept.
sentences.chinese: 他有了自己的独特性和生命力，并传播一种价值理念。

name: rustic
trans: adj. 乡村的；纯朴的；粗野的；手工粗糙的

sentences.english: The village had a certain rustic charm .
sentences.chinese: 这个村庄有一种迷人的田园风情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乡村的；纯朴的；粗野的；手工粗糙的
detailed_translations.english: simple, old-fashioned, and not spoiled by modern developments, in a way that is typical of the countryside
someone from the country, especially a farm worker

name: biologist
trans: n. 生物学家

sentences.english: Similarly, every time a biologist discovers a new species, there is the opportunity to honour someone or something.
sentences.chinese: 类似地，每次一位生物学家发现一个新物种，就又有了一个纪念某人或某事的机会。

sentences.english: One biologist developed a formula for how much genetic material would have to be to saved in the act of altruism for it to be worthwhile.
sentences.chinese: 一位生物学家发展了一套公式，用来计算到底有多少遗传物质可以被保留下来的时候，利他的行为才是值得的。

sentences.english: An evolutionary biologist would say physical activity is the only voluntary means you have of varying or regulating your energy expenditure.
sentences.chinese: 一个进化生物学家会说体力活动是唯一的志愿就是你的不同或管理您的能源开支的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies or works in biology

name: decent
trans: adj. 正派的；得体的；相当好的

sentences.english: a decent burial
sentences.chinese: 得体的葬礼

sentences.english: Paul visited the local bars more frequently than was decent for a senior lecturer.
sentences.chinese: 保罗过于频繁地光顾当地酒吧，不太合乎高级讲师的身份。

sentences.english: The chairman did the decent thing (= did what people thought he ought to ) and resigned.
sentences.chinese: 主席体面地辞去了职务。

detailed_translations.english: following moral standards that are acceptable to society

name: facilitate
trans: vt. 促进；帮助；使容易

sentences.english: The new trade agreement should facilitate more rapid economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 新贸易协定应当会加快经济发展。

sentences.english: Structured teaching facilitates learning.
sentences.chinese: 有条理的教导有利于学习。

detailed_translations.english: to make an action or a process possible or easier

name: manipulator
trans: n. [机] 操纵器，调制器；操作者

name: hardcore
trans: n. 硬核；硬底层；碎砖垫层

detailed_translations.english: a style of rock music characterized by short fast numbers with minimal melody and aggressive delivery

name: irritate
trans: vt. 刺激，使兴奋；激怒

sentences.english: It really irritates me when he doesn’t help around the house.
sentences.chinese: 家里的事情他一点都不帮忙，真让我恼火。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel annoyed or impatient, especially by doing something many times or for a long period of time

name: completion
trans: n. 完成，结束；实现

sentences.english: The house is nearing completion (= almost finished ) .
sentences.chinese: 房子即将完工。

sentences.english: The project has a completion date of December 22nd.
sentences.chinese: 该项目的完成日期是12月22日。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being finished

name: pertain
trans: vi. 属于；关于；适合

sentences.english: ...matters pertaining to naval district defence.
sentences.chinese: …与海军区域防卫有关的问题。

detailed_translations.english: If one thing pertains to another, it relates, belongs, or applies to it

name: scenario
trans: n. 方案；情节；剧本；设想

sentences.english: The conflict degenerating into civil war is everybody's nightmare scenario.
sentences.chinese: 这场冲突恶化成内战成为每个人的恶梦。

detailed_translations.english: a written description of the characters, place, and things that will happen in a film, play etc

name: classify
trans: vt. 分类；分等

sentences.english: We’d classify Drabble’s novels under ‘Romance’.
sentences.chinese: 我们把德拉布尔的小说归类为“言情小说”。

sentences.english: Families are classified according to the father’s occupation.
sentences.chinese: 各个家庭按父亲的职业分类。

detailed_translations.english: to decide what group something belongs to

name: nun
trans: n. 修女，尼姑

sentences.english: Mr. Thomas was taught by the Catholic nuns whose school he attended to work and study hard.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯先生受教于天主教修女。在修女开办的学校里他专心工作，刻苦学习。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is a member of a group of religious women that live together in a convent

name: metabolism
trans: n. [生理] 新陈代谢

sentences.english: This drug speeds up your metabolism.
sentences.chinese: 这种药物会加快你的新陈代谢。

detailed_translations.english: the chemical processes by which food is changed into energy in your body

name: fling
trans: n. 掷，抛；嘲弄；急冲

sentences.english: He flung the box into the river.
sentences.chinese: 他把盒子扔进河里。

sentences.english: People cheered and flung their hats into the air.
sentences.chinese: 民众欢呼着把帽子抛向空中。

detailed_translations.english: to throw something somewhere using a lot of force

name: fingerprint
trans: n. 指纹；手印

sentences.english: His fingerprints were all over the gun.
sentences.chinese: 枪上到处是他的指纹。

sentences.english: He was careful not to leave any fingerprints .
sentences.chinese: 他小心地不留下指纹。

sentences.english: The police questioned Beresford and took his fingerprints (= made a record of them ) .
sentences.chinese: 警察审问了贝雷斯福德，并提取了他的指纹。

sentences.english: He took her to jail, where she was fingerprinted and booked.
sentences.chinese: 他将她带到监狱，她在那里被提取了指纹并登记在册。

detailed_translations.english: a mark made by the pattern of lines at the end of a person’s finger, which is used by the police to find out who has committed a crime
If someone is fingerprinted, the police take their fingerprints

name: grotesque
trans: n. 奇异风格；怪异的东西

sentences.english: Grass's novels are peopled with outlandish characters: grotesques, clowns, scarecrows, dwarfs.
sentences.chinese: 格拉斯的小说充斥着稀奇古怪的人物：丑陋的怪人、小丑、邋遢的人以及侏儒。

detailed_translations.english: a grotesque style in art

detailed_translations.chinese: 奇形怪状的；奇怪的；可笑的
detailed_translations.english: unpleasant, shocking, and offensive

name: pervasive
trans: adj. 普遍的；到处渗透的；流行的

sentences.english: the pervasive influence of television
sentences.chinese: 电视无所不在的影响

sentences.english: the all-pervasive mood of apathy
sentences.chinese: 到处弥漫的冷漠情绪

detailed_translations.chinese: 普遍的；到处渗透的；流行的
detailed_translations.english: existing everywhere

name: magnetic
trans: adj. 地磁的；有磁性的；有吸引力的

sentences.english: magnetic forces
sentences.chinese: 磁力

sentences.english: a magnetic personality
sentences.chinese: 富有魅力的个性

detailed_translations.english: concerning or produced by  magnetism

name: exemplify
trans: vt. 例证；例示

sentences.english: Problems are exemplified in the report.
sentences.chinese: 问题都在报告中作了举例说明。

detailed_translations.english: to give an example of something

name: gradually
trans: adv. 逐步地；渐渐地

sentences.english: Jill gradually became aware of an awful smell.
sentences.chinese: 吉尔渐渐地闻到了一股难闻的气味。

sentences.english: Gradually, my ankle got better.
sentences.chinese: 我的脚踝慢慢好了。

detailed_translations.english: slowly, over a long period of time

name: effectively
trans: adv. 有效地，生效地；有力地；实际上

sentences.english: Children have to learn to communicate effectively.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子应该学会有效地沟通。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that produces the result that was intended

name: impulse
trans: n. 冲动；[电子] 脉冲；刺激；神经冲动；推动力

sentences.english: a sudden impulse to laugh
sentences.chinese: 突然想笑的冲动

sentences.english: It is the passions which provide the main impulse of music.
sentences.chinese: 激情是音乐创作的主要动力。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong desire to do something without thinking about whether it is a sensible thing to do

name: reintroduce
trans: vt. 再引入；再提出；再介绍

name: visualize
trans: vt. 形象，形象化；想像，设想

sentences.english: I tried to visualize the house while he was describing it.
sentences.chinese: 我一边听他描述，一边想象那房子的样子。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture of someone or something in your mind

name: viper
trans: n. 毒蛇；毒如蛇蝎的人，阴险的人

name: phonograph
trans: n. 留声机；[电子] 电唱机

sentences.english: Edison is credited with the invention of the phonograph.
sentences.chinese: 留声机的发明应归功于爱迪生。

sentences.english: American inventor Thomas Edison, who was considered the father of sound recording, developed the phonograph in 1877, the first device to record music in the world.
sentences.chinese: 被誉为录音之父的美国发明家托马斯·爱迪生于1877年发明了留声机，这是世界上第一台录音设备。

detailed_translations.english: a  record player

name: inventor
trans: n. 发明家；[专利] 发明人；创造者

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell, the inventor of the telephone
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大·格雷厄姆·贝尔，电话的发明者

detailed_translations.english: someone who has invented something, or whose job is to invent things

name: shunt

detailed_translations.chinese: 血液循环；（资料、货币等）流通
detailed_translations.english: the movement of blood around your body

name: surge
trans: n. 汹涌；大浪，波涛；汹涌澎湃；巨涌

sentences.english: a device that protects your computer against electrical surges
sentences.chinese: 一台计算机电涌保护设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 汹涌；大浪，波涛；汹涌澎湃；巨涌
detailed_translations.english: a sudden quick movement of a liquid, electricity, chemical etc through something
if a feeling surges or surges up, you begin to feel it very strongly

name: constitute
trans: vt. 组成，构成；建立；任命

sentences.english: We must redefine what constitutes a family.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须对家庭的构成重新定义。

detailed_translations.english: to be the parts that together form sth

name: distortion
trans: n. 变形；[物] 失真；扭曲；曲解

sentences.english: a distortion of the facts
sentences.chinese: 对事实的歪曲

sentences.english: modern alloys that are resistant to wear and distortion
sentences.chinese: 耐磨、防变形的新型合金

detailed_translations.english: the changing of something into something that is not true or not acceptable

name: fatality
trans: n. 死亡；宿命；致命性；不幸；灾祸

sentences.english: a 50% increase in the number of traffic fatalities
sentences.chinese: 交通事故死亡人数50%的增长

detailed_translations.chinese: 死亡；宿命；致命性；不幸；灾祸
detailed_translations.english: a death in an accident or a violent attack

name: figurative
trans: adj. 比喻的；修饰丰富的；形容多的

sentences.english: He’s my son, in the figurative sense of the word.
sentences.chinese: 打个比方，他就像是我的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比喻的；修饰丰富的；形容多的
detailed_translations.english: a figurative word or phrase is used in a different way from its usual meaning, to give you a particular idea or picture in your mind

name: riddle
trans: n. 谜语；粗筛；谜一般的人、东西、事情等

sentences.english: See if you can solve this riddle .
sentences.chinese: 看看你能不能猜出这个谜语。

detailed_translations.english: to solve, explain, or interpret (a riddle or riddles)

detailed_translations.chinese: 谜语；粗筛；谜一般的人、东西、事情等
detailed_translations.english: a question that is deliberately very confusing and has a humorous or clever answer

name: bow
trans: n. 弓；鞠躬；船首

sentences.english: She bowed and left the stage.
sentences.chinese: 她鞠了一躬，离开了舞台。

sentences.english: Corbett entered the room, bowing respectfully.
sentences.chinese: 科比特走进房间，恭敬地鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: The servant bowed low and handed his master the sealed note.
sentences.chinese: 仆人深深一鞠躬，把那个封好的短笺递给了主人。

sentences.english: This is done with a formal bow to the king or queen.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，还要向国王或女王正式鞠躬行礼。

detailed_translations.english: to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an  audience
the act of bending the top part of your body forward to show respect for someone when you meet them, or as a way of thanking an audience

name: mechanics
trans: n. 力学（用作单数）；结构；技术；机械学（用作单数）

sentences.english: He has not studied mechanics or engineering.
sentences.chinese: 他没有学习过力学或者工程学。

detailed_translations.english: the part of physics that deals with the natural forces that act on moving or stationary objects

name: cowpox
trans: n. [兽医] 牛痘

name: trajectory
trans: n. [物] 轨道，轨线；[航][军] 弹道

sentences.english: The decision was certain to affect the trajectory of French politics for some time to come.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定在未来的一段时间里必将影响法国的政治轨迹。

detailed_translations.chinese: [物] 轨道，轨线；[航][军] 弹道
detailed_translations.english: the curved path of an object that has been fired or thrown through the air

name: splash
trans: n. 飞溅的水；污点；卖弄

sentences.english: Water splashed onto the floor.
sentences.chinese: 水哗的一声泼洒在地板上。

sentences.english: He splashed cold water on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他把冷水往脸上泼。

sentences.english: We heard the splash when she fell into the pool.
sentences.chinese: 她掉进游泳池时我们听见扑通的一声。

detailed_translations.english: (of liquid) to fall noisily onto a surface
the sound of sth hitting liquid or of liquid hitting sth

name: formalistic
trans: 形式主义

name: departure
trans: n. 离开；出发；违背

sentences.english: There are several departures for New York every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天有好几个班次去纽约。

detailed_translations.english: an act of leaving a place, especially at the start of a journey

name: sediment
trans: n. 沉积；沉淀物

sentences.english: a thick layer of sediment
sentences.chinese: 一层厚厚的沉积物

detailed_translations.english: solid substances that settle at the bottom of a liquid

name: donor
trans: n. 捐赠者；供者；赠送人

sentences.english: We urgently need more assistance from donor countries (= countries that give money, food etc to help in poor countries or disaster areas ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们急需捐赠国的更多援助。

sentences.english: An anonymous donor (= whose name is unknown ) has given £500 towards the restoration fund.
sentences.chinese: 一位匿名捐赠者向重建基金捐了500英镑。

sentences.english: ...the severe shortage of donor organs.
sentences.chinese: …捐献器官的严重匮乏。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group etc that gives something, especially money, to help an organization or country

detailed_translations.chinese: 捐献的；经人工授精出生的
detailed_translations.english: Donor organs or parts are organs or parts of the body which people allow doctors to use to help people who are ill

name: conversion
trans: n. 转换；变换；[金融] 兑换；改变信仰

sentences.english: ...the conversion of disused rail lines into cycle routes.
sentences.chinese: …把废弃的铁路改变成自行车道。

detailed_translations.english: when you change something from one form, purpose, or system to a different one

name: adventurous
trans: adj. 爱冒险的；大胆的；充满危险的

sentences.english: Andy isn’t a very adventurous cook.
sentences.chinese: 安迪不是一个敢于大胆创新的厨师。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱冒险的；大胆的；充满危险的
detailed_translations.english: not afraid of taking risks or trying new things

name: ornament
trans: n. 装饰；[建][服装] 装饰物；教堂用品

sentences.english: a shelf covered with books and ornaments
sentences.chinese: 摆满书籍和装饰品的架子

sentences.english: a cabinet in which she kept her collection of china ornaments
sentences.chinese: 她放置瓷器摆设收藏品的柜子

detailed_translations.chinese: 装饰品，点缀品；装饰，点缀
detailed_translations.english: a small object that you keep in your house because it is beautiful rather than useful

detailed_translations.chinese: 装饰， 点缀， 美化

name: bibliography
trans: n. 参考书目；文献目录

sentences.english: At the end of this chapter there is a select bibliography of useful books.
sentences.chinese: 本章末尾附着有用书籍的精选书目。

detailed_translations.english: a list of all the books and articles used in preparing a piece of writing

name: urgency
trans: n. 紧急；催促；紧急的事

sentences.english: In case of urgency, call the police.
sentences.chinese: 一旦发生紧急情况，打电话给警察。

sentences.english: I appreciate the sense of urgency because I feel it myself.
sentences.chinese: 我欣赏这种紧迫的感觉因为我自己就能体会到。

sentences.english: However pressing the need and urgency of the problem one should not proceed without a plausible plan.
sentences.chinese: 无论需要多么紧迫，问题多么紧急，一个人不能没有看似有理的计划就开始行动。

name: inventive
trans: adj. 发明的；有发明才能的；独出心裁的

sentences.english: It inspired me to be more inventive with my own cooking.
sentences.chinese: 它激励我在自己烹饪时更具创造力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明的；有发明才能的；独出心裁的
detailed_translations.english: An inventive person is good at inventing things or has clever and original ideas

name: refurbish
trans: vt. 刷新；再磨光

sentences.english: We have spent money on refurbishing the offices.
sentences.chinese: 我们已在这些办公室的翻新上花了钱。

detailed_translations.english: To refurbish a building or room means to clean it and decorate it and make it more attractive or better equipped

name: habitat
trans: n. [生态] 栖息地，产地

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: corollary
trans: n. 推论；必然的结果

sentences.english: The number of prisoners increased as a corollary of the government's determination to combat violent crime.
sentences.chinese: 政府决心打击暴力犯罪，其后果是囚犯数量增加了。

detailed_translations.english: something that is the direct result of something else

name: Everest
trans: n. 珠穆朗玛峰（世界最高峰）

name: constantly
trans: adv. 不断地；时常地

sentences.english: He talked constantly about his work.
sentences.chinese: 他不断地谈到他的工作。

sentences.english: The English language is constantly changing .
sentences.chinese: 英语在不断地变化。

detailed_translations.english: all the time, or very often

name: guru
trans: n. 古鲁（指印度教等宗教的宗师或领袖）；领袖；专家

sentences.english: It's up to us to either ignore the morale booster inside us or go out to the world and search for spiritual guru's and happiness, when all these things are very much present within us.
sentences.chinese: 当我们面临这些问题的时候，我们该决定是否忽略我们内心的道德推动或者接触这个世界来寻找精神领袖和快乐。

sentences.english: Become a trader, bounty hunter, rebel, stock market guru or a deadly space pirate.
sentences.chinese: 成为一个商人，津贴猎人，叛乱者，股票市场领袖或者一名极度的空间盗版者。

name: scrutinize
trans: n. 仔细或彻底检查

sentences.english: He scrutinized the document.
sentences.chinese: 他细阅了这份文件。

sentences.english: She scrutinized his face.
sentences.chinese: 她细细端详他的脸。

detailed_translations.english: to examine someone or something very carefully

name: strive
trans: vi. 努力；奋斗；抗争

sentences.english: I was still striving to be successful.
sentences.chinese: 我仍在努力争取成功。

sentences.english: We must continue to strive for greater efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须继续为提高效率而努力。

detailed_translations.english: to make a great effort to achieve something

name: analyse
trans: vt. 分析；分解；细察

sentences.english: She still needs to analyse the data.
sentences.chinese: 她仍需要分析这些数据。

sentences.english: You need to sit down and analyse why you feel so upset.
sentences.chinese: 你得坐下来想一想自己为什么会那么生气。

sentences.english: Joe had never tried to analyze their relationship.
sentences.chinese: 乔从未试图去理清他们的关系。

detailed_translations.english: to examine the nature or structure of sth, especially by separating it into its parts, in order to understand or explain it

name: regimen
trans: n. [医] 养生法；生活规则；政体；支配

sentences.english: Patients maintain a strict dietary regimen.
sentences.chinese: 病人严格遵守饮食规律。

detailed_translations.chinese: [医] 养生法；生活规则；政体；支配
detailed_translations.english: a special plan of food, exercise etc that is intended to improve your health

name: gladiator
trans: n. 斗剑者；古罗马公开表演的格斗者；争论者

sentences.chinese: 这是个仅为勇士而且是仅为此行里的大力士勇士所设的竞技场。

detailed_translations.chinese: 角斗士， 与野兽搏斗者
detailed_translations.english: a soldier who fought against other men or wild animals as an entertainment in ancient Rome

name: irrational
trans: n. [数] 无理数

sentences.chinese: 对飞行非理性的恐惧

sentences.english: He’s becoming increasingly irrational.
sentences.chinese: 他变得越来越不可理喻了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不合理的；无理性的；荒谬的
detailed_translations.english: not based on clear thought or reason

name: dissipate
trans: vi. 驱散；放荡

sentences.english: As he thought it over, his anger gradually dissipated.
sentences.chinese: 他想明白后，怒气就渐渐消了。

sentences.english: Little by little, the smoke was dissipated by the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 在微风的吹拂下烟雾渐渐地消散了。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 使消散， 使消失， 驱散； 浪费， 挥霍
detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this

name: convey
trans: vt. 传达；运输；让与

sentences.english: All this information can be conveyed in a simple diagram.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些信息可以通过一张简单的图表来表示。

sentences.english: Ads convey the message that thin is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 广告传递的信息是: 瘦就是美。

sentences.english: He was sent to convey a message to the UN Secretary General.
sentences.chinese: 他被派去向联合国秘书长传达一条信息。

detailed_translations.english: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

name: horn
trans: n. 喇叭，号角；角

sentences.english: A mature cow has horns.
sentences.chinese: 成年母牛头上长有角。

detailed_translations.english: a container in the shape of an animal’s horn, used in the past for drinking from, carrying  gunpowder  etc

name: pluralism
trans: n. 多元主义；多元论；兼任

sentences.english: a nation characterized by cultural pluralism
sentences.chinese: 以多元文化为特色的国家

detailed_translations.english: when people of many different races, religions, and political beliefs live together in the same society, or the belief that this can happen successfully

name: chef
trans: n. 厨师，大师傅

sentences.english: a master chef
sentences.chinese: 手艺高超的厨师长

sentences.english: a pastry chef
sentences.chinese: 糕饼师傅

detailed_translations.english: a skilled cook, especially the main cook in a hotel or restaurant

name: nucleus
trans: n. 核，核心；原子核

sentences.english: Neutrons and protons are bound together in the nucleus of an atom.
sentences.chinese: 在一个原子的核内，中子和质子聚合在一起。

sentences.english: the nucleus of an effective team
sentences.chinese: 高效团队的核心

detailed_translations.english: the central part of an atom, made up of neutrons, protons, and other elementary particles

name: traumatic
trans: adj. （生理）外伤的

name: skyscraper
trans: n. 摩天楼，超高层大楼；特别高的东西

sentences.english: The skyscraper towers into the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 那幢摩天大楼高耸入云。

sentences.english: The majesty of the skyscraper awed me .
sentences.chinese: 这幢摩天大厦的雄伟气势令我惊叹。

sentences.english: Suddenly, a top needle of a skyscraper is pressing toward him. He fails to dodge and bumps heavily on the concrete needle.
sentences.chinese: 突然，一座摩天大厦的尖型顶柱朝他逼来，他躲避不及，重重地撞在混凝土顶柱上。

detailed_translations.english: a very tall modern city building

name: regurgitation
trans: n. 回流；反刍；流回

name: ailment
trans: n. 小病；不安

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["minor ailments"]}
sentences.chinese: 小恙

detailed_translations.english: an illness that is not very serious

name: cohort
trans: n. 一群；步兵大队；支持者；同生群

name: thaw
trans: n. 解冻；融雪

sentences.english: The lake thawed in March.
sentences.chinese: 3月里，湖水解冻了。

detailed_translations.english: if ice or snow thaws, or if the sun thaws it, it turns into water
a period of warm weather during which snow and ice melt

name: compost
trans: n. 堆肥；混合物

sentences.english: ...a small compost heap.
sentences.chinese: …一小堆肥堆。

detailed_translations.english: a mixture of decayed plants, leaves etc used to improve the quality of soil

name: pathology
trans: n. 病理（学）; 〈比喻〉异常状态

sentences.english: One person may show lots of pathology in their brain while another shows very little, yet both may have had dementia.
sentences.chinese: 即使两人都患有痴呆症，但一人的大脑可能在病理现象中呈现较多，而另一个人可能较少。

sentences.english: According to the scientific team, only one of these four categories of gamblers actually shows signs of a significant pathology.
sentences.chinese: 根据科学小组得知，事实上在这四种赌徒里只有一种显示出明显的病理学的迹象。

sentences.english: It makes sense to leave the ovaries if there is no risk factors or pathology at the time of surgery, especially in young women since those are the ones who seem to be most affected.
sentences.chinese: 斯科西亚说，“如果在手术时没有出现危险因素或病理原因，那么保留卵巢就是合理的，尤其是那些年轻妇女，因为她们似乎是受到影响最大的人群。”

detailed_translations.english: the study of the causes and effects of illnesses

name: flap
trans: n. 拍打，拍打声；神经紧张；[航] 襟翼

sentences.english: The flags were flapping in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 旗帜在微风中飘扬。

detailed_translations.chinese: 飘动， 拍动； 振翅
detailed_translations.english: if a bird flaps its wings, it moves them up and down in order to fly

detailed_translations.chinese: 片状垂悬物；飘动，摆动，振动；激动，慌忙状态
detailed_translations.english: a thin flat piece of cloth, paper, skin etc that is fixed by one edge to a surface, which you can lift up easily
to move quickly up and down or from side to side, often making a noise

name: partisan
trans: n. 游击队；虔诚信徒；党羽

sentences.english: British newspapers are highly partisan .
sentences.chinese: 英国报纸的立场壁垒分明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 党派的；效忠的；偏袒的；盲目推崇的
detailed_translations.english: strongly supporting a particular political party, plan or leader, usually without considering the other choices carefully
a member of an armed group that fights against an enemy that has taken control of its country

name: reap
trans: vt. 收获，获得；收割

sentences.english: The peasants leaned down to reap wheat.
sentences.chinese: 农民们俯身收割小麦。

detailed_translations.english: to cut and collect a crop of grain

name: socioeconomic
trans: adj. 社会经济学的

name: rectify
trans: vt. 改正；精馏；整流

sentences.english: I did my best to rectify the situation, but the damage was already done.
sentences.chinese: 我竭尽全力去挽回局面，但损害已经造成了。

detailed_translations.english: to correct something that is wrong

name: shortfall
trans: n. 差额；缺少

sentences.english: The government has refused to make up a $30,000 shortfall in funding.
sentences.chinese: 政府已经拒绝补足3万美元的资金短缺。

detailed_translations.english: the difference between the amount you have and the amount you need or expect

name: chlorophyll
trans: n. [植][生化] 叶绿素

sentences.english: The chlorophyll in wheatgrass also helps to purify the liver.
sentences.chinese: 麦草中的叶绿素同样可以帮助净化肝脏。

sentences.english: Wheatgrass has antibiotic properties and is packed with chlorophyll as it is a plant.
sentences.chinese: 麦草含有抗生素，由于它是一种植物，所以含有许多叶绿素。

sentences.english: This could be estimated at 1000 litres of hydrogen for 330 grams of chlorophyll per day whereas for example colza produces roughly only 1000 litres of oil per hectare . . .
sentences.chinese: 这种农场每天估计能够产生1000升氢气，而且只消耗330克叶绿素； 而比如种植菜籽，每公顷土地才能产生大约1000升油。

detailed_translations.english: the green-coloured substance in plants

name: hardware
trans: n. 计算机硬件；五金器具

sentences.english: 英文例句:To be totally secure, you need a piece of hardware that costs about $200.
sentences.chinese: 为保证绝对安全，你需要一个花费约为两百美元的硬件。

sentences.english: ...a shop from which an uncle had sold hardware and timber.
sentences.chinese: …一家叔叔曾经在那里卖五金器具和木材的店铺。

detailed_translations.english: computer machinery and equipment, as opposed to the programs that make computers work

name: reconstruction
trans: n. 再建，重建；改造；复兴

sentences.english: ...America's part in the postwar reconstruction of Germany.
sentences.chinese: …美国在战后德国重建中扮演的角色。

detailed_translations.english: the work that is done to repair the damage to a city, industry etc, especially after a war

name: optimistic
trans: adj. 乐观的；乐观主义的
