name: identifiable
trans: adj. 可辨认的；可认明的；可证明是同一的

sentences.english: In the corridor were four dirty, ragged bundles, just identifiable as human beings.
sentences.chinese: 走廊里有4堆脏兮兮、衣衫褴褛的东西，依稀可辨出人形。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可辨认的；可认明的；可证明是同一的
detailed_translations.english: able to be recognized

name: heraldic
trans: 纹章学的

name: admission
trans: n. 承认；入场费；进入许可；坦白；录用

sentences.english: Reese, by his own admission , lacks the necessary experience.
sentences.chinese: 里斯自己也承认缺乏必要的经验。

sentences.english: No admission after 10 pm.
sentences.chinese: 晚上10点以后免进。

sentences.english: The Museum has no admission charge .
sentences.chinese: 那家博物馆不收门票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认；准许进(加)入；入场费
detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you admit that something is true or that you have done something wrong

name: baffle
trans: n. 挡板；困惑

sentences.english: The question baffled me completely.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题把我彻底难倒了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…困惑；使…受挫折；用挡板控制
detailed_translations.english: if something baffles you, you cannot understand or explain it at all

name: gale
trans: n. [气象] 大风，狂风；（突发的）一阵

sentences.english: a severe gale
sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风

detailed_translations.chinese: [气象] 大风，狂风；（突发的）一阵
detailed_translations.english: a very strong wind

name: sketch
trans: n. 素描；略图；梗概

sentences.english: So if we just sketch that.
sentences.chinese: 那么如果我们把那画个草图。

sentences.english: He squiggled a sketch on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在地上胡乱地画了个草图。

detailed_translations.english: a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail
a short humorous scene on a television programme, in a theatre etc, that is part of a larger show

name: thrive
trans: vi. 繁荣，兴旺；茁壮成长

sentences.english: plants that thrive in tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 在热带雨林蓬勃生长的植物

sentences.english: a business which managed to thrive during a recession
sentences.chinese: 在经济萧条时期也能顺利发展的一家企业

detailed_translations.english: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

name: abide
trans: vi. 持续；忍受；停留

sentences.english: I can't abide people with no sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌和没有幽默感的人打交道。

sentences.english: You'll have to abide by the rules of the club.
sentences.chinese: 你必须遵守俱乐部的规定。

detailed_translations.english: bear, stand

name: transaction
trans: n. 交易；事务；办理；会报，学报

sentences.english: The bank charges a fixed rate for each transaction.
sentences.chinese: 银行对每一笔业务收取固定费用。

sentences.english: the transaction of government business
sentences.chinese: 处理政府事务

detailed_translations.english: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

name: excellence
trans: n. 优秀；美德；长处

sentences.english: ...the top award for excellence in journalism and the arts.
sentences.chinese: …新闻与艺术界的最高杰出奖。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something has the quality of excellence, they are extremely good in some way

name: habitation
trans: n. 居住；住所

sentences.english: There was no sign of habitation as far as the eye could see.
sentences.chinese: 放眼望去，了无人烟。

detailed_translations.english: a building that is unfit for human habitation is not safe or healthy for people to live in

name: hurricane
trans: n. 飓风，暴风

sentences.english: I still remember a hurricane that hit us thirty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得三十年前袭击我们的一次飓风。

sentences.english: Our love is not fierce, not hot, but despite the tsunami hurricane, also vowed.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱，不剧烈，不炙热，可是任凭海啸飓风，也矢志不渝。

sentences.english: If an earthquake, hurricane, winter storm, or other disaster strikes your community, you might not have access to food , water, and electricity for days or even weeks.
sentences.chinese: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

detailed_translations.english: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water

name: importance
trans: n. 价值；重要；重大；傲慢

sentences.english: He was full of his own importance (= he behaved in an annoying way which showed that he thought he was very important ).
sentences.chinese: 他自以为很了不起。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being important

name: decomposition
trans: n. 分解，腐烂；变质

sentences.english: So no one decomposition is sufficient.
sentences.chinese: 因此一种分解是不够的。

sentences.english: This is an important difference, because it means that the additional transaction decomposition can be turned on only when required.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个很重要的不同点，因为这意味着仅仅在需要时才进行附加的事务分解。

sentences.english: Unlike other decomposition solutions, due to this algorithm, there are no constraints that allow only sibling or child elements/attributes to be mapped to the same table.
sentences.chinese: 由于有了此算法，与其他的分解解决方案不同，没有只允许将兄弟或孩子元素/属性映射到同一个表的约束。

detailed_translations.english: Decomposition is the process of decay that takes place when a living thing changes chemically after dying

name: chimpanzee
trans: n. [脊椎] 黑猩猩

sentences.english: So when you go from head to toe, you're seeing a mosaic creature that is neither chimpanzee, nor is it human.
sentences.chinese: 所以从头到脚，让人看到的是一个在黑猩猩和人类之间模棱两可的生物，这就是始祖地人猿。

sentences.english: By hunting or gathering away from the group, both chimpanzee and dolphin moms ensure that what they find goes to their young.
sentences.chinese: 黑猩猩和海豚妈妈们远离群体打猎和收集食物，并保证他们所找到的食物都给孩子们。

sentences.english: It was, if I can give a chimpanzee language, I can empty the contents of his mind. He can tell me what he's thinking, how he sees the world.
sentences.chinese: 他的想法是，如果我能交给黑猩猩一种语言的话，我就可以掏空他的想法，他可以告诉我他在想什么，他是怎样看这个世界的。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent African animal that is like a large monkey without a tail

name: Dinosaur
trans: 恐龙

name: scrutiny
trans: n. 详细审查；监视；细看；选票复查

sentences.english: Their activities have come under police scrutiny .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动受到警方的严密监视。

detailed_translations.chinese: 详细检查， 仔细观察
detailed_translations.english: careful and thorough examination of someone or something

name: hood
trans: n. 头巾；覆盖；兜帽

sentences.english: Why don’t you put your hood up if you’re cold?
sentences.chinese: 你冷的话为什么不把风帽拉起来？

detailed_translations.english: a part of a coat, jacket etc that you can pull up to cover your head
to cover or provide with or as if with a hood

name: puzzle
trans: n. 谜；难题；迷惑

sentences.english: The meaning of the poem has always been a puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 那首诗的含义始终是个谜。

sentences.english: He thought he had solved the puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他已经解开了那个谜。

sentences.english: What puzzles me is why his books are so popular.
sentences.chinese: 令我不解的是，他的书为什么如此受欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: something that is difficult to understand or explain
to confuse someone or make them feel slightly anxious because they do not understand something

name: frivolous
trans: adj. 无聊的；轻佻的；琐碎的

sentences.english: I just decided I was a bit too frivolous to be a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 我只是认定自己有点儿太轻率，不适合当医生。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as frivolous, you mean they behave in a silly or light-hearted way, rather than being serious and sensible

name: propagate
trans: vt. 传播；传送；繁殖；宣传

sentences.english: The group launched a website to propagate its ideas.
sentences.chinese: 这个团体建了一个网站来宣扬他们的主张。

sentences.english: The plant can be propagated from seed.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物可由种子繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: to spread an idea, belief etc to many people

name: identification
trans: n. 鉴定，识别；认同；身份证明

sentences.english: Do you have any identification?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么身份证明文件吗？

sentences.english: His body was taken to Brighton mortuary for identification.
sentences.chinese: 他的尸体被送到布赖顿停尸所确认身份。

detailed_translations.english: official papers or cards, such as your passport, that prove who you are

name: debris
trans: n. 碎片，残骸

sentences.english: She was hit by flying debris from the blast.
sentences.chinese: 她被爆炸产生的飞散碎片击中。

detailed_translations.english: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc

name: assert
trans: vt. 维护，坚持；断言；主张；声称

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

name: innovate
trans: vi. 创新；改革；革新

sentences.english: the need for large businesses to innovate
sentences.chinese: 大公司革新的需要

sentences.english: The company has successfully innovated new products and services.
sentences.chinese: 公司成功地创出了新产品和服务。

detailed_translations.english: to start to use new ideas, methods, or inventions

name: casual
trans: n. 便装；临时工人；待命士兵

sentences.english: a casual manner
sentences.chinese: 漫不经心的态度

sentences.english: His eyes were angry, though he sounded casual.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他的语气满不在乎，但他的眼神充满怒气。

sentences.english: Marsha was quite casual about appearing on TV.
sentences.chinese: 玛莎对于上电视很无所谓。

sentences.english: a casual conversation
sentences.chinese: 随便的谈话

sentences.english: He made some casual remark (= one without thinking much about it ) about her holiday.
sentences.chinese: 他随口提到了她度假的事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 漫不经心的，随便的；偶然的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and not worried, or seeming not to care about something

name: timely
trans: adj. 及时的；适时的

sentences.english: The fight ended only with the timely arrival of the police.
sentences.chinese: 幸亏警察及时赶到，打斗总算停止。

detailed_translations.english: done or happening at exactly the right time

name: interact
trans: n. 幕间剧；幕间休息

sentences.english: While the other children interacted and played together, Ted ignored them.
sentences.chinese: 当其他孩子们相互交往、一起玩耍时，泰德却不理他们。

detailed_translations.english: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

name: navicular
trans: 舟状的

name: parasitic
trans: adj. 寄生的（等于parasitical）

sentences.english: parasitic fungi
sentences.chinese: 寄生真菌

detailed_translations.english: living in or on another plant or animal and getting food from them

name: coastline
trans: n. 海岸线

sentences.english: California’s rugged coastline
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚崎岖的海岸线

sentences.english: a beautiful stretch of coastline
sentences.chinese: 一段景色优美的海岸线

detailed_translations.english: the land on the edge of the coast, especially the shape of this land as seen from the air

name: outperform
trans: vt. 胜过；做得比……好

sentences.english: Stocks generally outperform other investments.
sentences.chinese: 股票总体上要优于其他投资。

detailed_translations.english: to be more successful than someone or something else

name: surfer
trans: n. 冲浪运动员，乘冲浪板冲浪的人

name: consensus
trans: n. 一致；舆论；合意

sentences.english: The EU Council of Finance Ministers failed to reach a consensus on the pace of integration.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟财政部长会议未能就一体化的进度达成共识。

sentences.english: the current consensus of opinion
sentences.chinese: 目前观点上的一致

sentences.english: The general consensus was that technology was a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 大家都认为科技是好东西。

sentences.english: the consensus politics of the fifties
sentences.chinese: 50年代的共识政治

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

name: consume
trans: vt. 消耗，消费；使…着迷；挥霍

sentences.english: Some of the most efficient refrigerators consume 70 percent less electricity than traditional models.
sentences.chinese: 一些能效最高的冰箱比传统型号少消耗70%的电。

detailed_translations.english: To consume an amount of fuel, energy, or time means to use it up
to use time, energy, goods etc

name: integrative
trans: adj. 综合的

name: predominate
trans: vt. 支配，主宰；在…中占优势

sentences.english: In this type of case, the rights of the parent predominate.
sentences.chinese: 像这样的案例，要首先考虑父母的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to have the most importance or influence, or to be most easily noticed

name: suppress
trans: vt. 抑制；镇压；废止

sentences.english: The uprising was ruthlessly suppressed.
sentences.chinese: 起义受到了残酷的镇压。

detailed_translations.english: to stop people from opposing the government, especially by using force

name: steadfast
trans: adj. 坚定的；不变的

sentences.english: her father’s steadfast love for her
sentences.chinese: 她父亲对她永不改变的爱

detailed_translations.english: being certain that you are right about something and refusing to change your opinion in any way

name: external
trans: n. 外部；外观；外面

sentences.english: The open cities will be testing grounds for our external policies.
sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.english: The ear canal also named middle ear splays out at the external position.
sentences.chinese: 耳道亦称中耳，内小外大呈喇叭状。

sentences.english: Riddled with a thousand gaping wounds, this reactionary clique is now beset with difficulties and contradictions both in internal and external affairs.
sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

name: dependent
trans: n. 依赖他人者；受赡养者

sentences.english: Jan’s mother was dependent on her for physical care.
sentences.chinese: 简的母亲要靠简来照顾。

sentences.english: Do you have any dependent children (= who you are still supporting financially ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有需要扶养的孩子？

detailed_translations.english: needing someone or something in order to exist, be successful, be healthy etc

name: repetition
trans: n. 重复；背诵；副本

sentences.english: Children used to learn by repetition.
sentences.chinese: 过去小孩子是通过背诵来学习的。

detailed_translations.english: doing or saying the same thing many times

name: strife
trans: n. 冲突；争吵；不和

sentences.english: Money is a major cause of strife in many marriages.
sentences.chinese: 钱在许多婚姻中是导致冲突的一个主要原因。

detailed_translations.english: trouble between two or more people or groups

name: accusation
trans: n. 控告，指控；谴责

sentences.english: The main accusation levelled against him was that he tried to avoid military service.
sentences.chinese: 对他提出的主要指控是他想逃避兵役。

sentences.english: Burton’s enemies had made false accusations against him.
sentences.chinese: 伯顿的敌人对他提出不实的指责。

sentences.english: She’s made all sorts of wild accusations against me in the past.
sentences.chinese: 她过去对我妄加指责，说了种种不是。

sentences.english: They fled the country, amid accusations of corruption.
sentences.chinese: 在一片贪污腐败的指责声中，他们逃离了该国。

detailed_translations.english: a statement saying that someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something wrong

name: Impressionism
trans: n. 印象派，印象主义

sentences.english: Impressionism has long been one of the most popular art movements.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，印象主义一直是最具有影响力的艺术运动之一。

sentences.english: Impressionism has long been one of the most popular art movements.Van Gogh‘s impressionistic paingting entitled "Dr.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，印象主义一直是最具有影响力的艺术运动之一。

detailed_translations.english: Impressionism is a style of painting developed in France between 1870 and 1900 that concentrated on showing the effects of light and colour rather than on clear and exact detail

name: geology
trans: n. 地质学；地质情况

sentences.english: He was visiting professor of geology at the University of Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是佐治亚大学的地质学客座教授。

sentences.english: the geology of the British Isles
sentences.chinese: 不列颠群岛的地质

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the earth, including the origin and history of the rocks and soil of which the earth is made

name: transient
trans: n. 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

sentences.english: transient fashions
sentences.chinese: 短暂的时尚

detailed_translations.english: continuing only for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

name: pore over
trans: 注视；钻研；凝视

name: folktale
trans: n. 民间故事；民间传说

name: fragment
trans: n. 碎片；片断或不完整部分

sentences.english: glass fragments
sentences.chinese: 玻璃碎片

detailed_translations.chinese: 碎片；片断或不完整部分
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger
to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval

name: diverge
trans: vt. 使偏离；使分叉

sentences.english: The two species diverged millions of years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这两个物种从数百万年前开始朝不同方向演变。

sentences.english: Global growth rates are diverging markedly.
sentences.chinese: 世界各地的增长率在发生明显的分化。

detailed_translations.english: if similar things diverge, they develop in different ways and so are no longer similar

name: terrestrial
trans: n. 陆地生物；地球上的人

sentences.english: ...terrestrial life forms.
sentences.chinese: …地球上的生命形态。

detailed_translations.chinese: 地球的；陆地的，[生物] 陆生的；人间的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the Earth rather than to the moon or other  planets

name: preliminary
trans: n. 准备；预赛；初步措施

sentences.english: the preliminary stages of the competition
sentences.chinese: 竞赛的预赛阶段

sentences.english: a preliminary draft
sentences.chinese: 初稿

detailed_translations.english: happening before something that is more important, often in order to prepare for it

detailed_translations.chinese: 初步做法， 起始行为

name: slave
trans: n. 奴隶；从动装置

sentences.english: a slave to fashion
sentences.chinese: 时尚的奴隶

detailed_translations.english: someone who is owned by another person and works for them for no money
to work very hard with little time to rest

name: modification
trans: n. 修改，修正；改变

sentences.english: They have used the same process for almost 50 years with only minor modifications.
sentences.chinese: 同样的工序他们用了将近50年，期间只做过很小的改动。

detailed_translations.english: a small change made in something such as a design, plan, or system

name: mandatory
trans: adj. 强制的；托管的；命令的

sentences.english: Murder carries a mandatory life sentence .
sentences.chinese: 谋杀罪依照法律要判无期徒刑。

sentences.english: The Council has made it mandatory for all nurses to attend a refresher course every three years.
sentences.chinese: 理事会规定所有护士必须每三年参加一次进修课程。

detailed_translations.english: if something is mandatory, the law says it must be done

name: paradoxical
trans: adj. 矛盾的；诡论的；似非而是的

sentences.english: Some sedatives produce the paradoxical effect of making the person more anxious.
sentences.chinese: 一些镇静剂产生出使人更紧张这样自相矛盾的结果。

detailed_translations.chinese: 矛盾的；诡论的；似非而是的
detailed_translations.english: If something is paradoxical, it involves two facts or qualities that seem to contradict each other

name: existence
trans: n. 存在，实在；生存，生活；存在物，实在物

sentences.english: Scientists have many theories about how the universe first came into existence (= started to exist ).
sentences.chinese: 关于宇宙的起源，科学家有多种理论。

sentences.english: Pablo led a miserable existence when he first moved to San Juan.
sentences.chinese: 巴勃罗刚搬到圣胡安时，生活很悲惨。

detailed_translations.english: the state of existing

name: genetic
trans: adj. 遗传的；基因的；起源的

sentences.english: genetic defects
sentences.chinese: 遗传性缺陷

sentences.english: each person’s genetic make-up
sentences.chinese: 每个人的遗传特征

sentences.english: genetic research
sentences.chinese: 基因研究

detailed_translations.english: relating to genes or genetics

name: telescope
trans: n. 望远镜；缩叠式旅行袋

sentences.english: The captain was rectifying his telescope.
sentences.chinese: 船长正在调他的望远镜。

sentences.english: The telescope reveals many distant stars to our sight.
sentences.chinese: 望远镜把许多遥远的星球显现在我们的眼前。

sentences.english: With the aid of a telescope a ship could be made out on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 借助望远镜可以看出在地平线上有一只船。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment shaped like a tube, used for making distant objects look larger and closer

name: ritual
trans: n. 仪式；惯例；礼制

sentences.english: ancient pagan rituals
sentences.chinese: 古老的异教仪式

sentences.english: the importance of religion and ritual in our lives
sentences.chinese: 我们生活中宗教和宗教仪式的重要性

sentences.english: The lady of the house performs the sacred ritual of lighting two candles.
sentences.chinese: 由女主人来完成点燃两根蜡烛的神圣仪式。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, in order to mark an important religious or social occasion

name: regeneration
trans: n. [生物][化学][物] 再生，重生；重建

sentences.english: But they can definitely determine how they plan to grow as more people move in, and also how they want to rehabilitate areas that need regeneration.
sentences.chinese: 但它们确实可以决定怎样在更多的人迁移进来的同时计划它们的增长，以及它们希望怎样修复需要重建的区域。

sentences.english: There are three parts to your hair: the hair shaft (the fiber), the hair bulb (the root) and the hair cycle (the period of rest and regeneration).
sentences.chinese: 我们的头发包含三个部分：毛干(纤维)，毛球(根部)和毛发周期(休息和再生的周期)。

sentences.english: And doctors are already experimenting with ways of using tactile cues to improve wound healing and regeneration.
sentences.chinese: 医生已经在试验运用触觉信号来提高伤口愈合及再生的方法。

name: pollination
trans: n. [农学] 授粉（作用）

sentences.english: The new research provides early evidence that climate change may be playing a role in driving down pollination.
sentences.chinese: 这项新的研究提供了初步证据，气候变化可能是促使授粉减少的一个因素。

sentences.english: They say there is risk of 'gene pollution' — where the inserted gene of GM plants affects non-target plants of similar kinds via pollination.
sentences.chinese: 他们说存在“基因污染”的危险——插入基因片段的转基因作物通过授粉途径对类似的非目标作物产生影响。

sentences.english: This is sobering because it suggests that pollination is vulnerable even in a relatively pristine environment that is free of pesticides and human disturbance but still subject to climate change.
sentences.chinese: 这是发人深省的，它表明授粉过程极易被打乱，甚至在一个相对平静安定的环境，没有农药和人为干扰，但仍然受到气候变化的影响。

name: emergent
trans: adj. 紧急的；浮现的；意外的；自然发生的

sentences.english: Discovering these patterns is the key to emergent design.
sentences.chinese: 发现这些模式是紧急设计的关键。

sentences.english: The real trick in emergent design is discovering these patterns.
sentences.chinese: 紧急设计的真正诀窍就是发现这些模式。

name: sideline
trans: n. 副业；球场边线；局外人的观点

detailed_translations.chinese: 副业；球场边线；局外人的观点
detailed_translations.english: an activity that you do as well as your main job or business, in order to earn more money

name: royalty
trans: n. 皇室；版税；王权；专利税

sentences.english: At school the other children treated them like royalty .
sentences.chinese: 在学校里，其他孩子将他们奉若王族。

detailed_translations.english: members of a royal family

name: elaborate
trans: adj. 精心制作的；详尽的；煞费苦心的

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

name: dialect
trans: n. 方言，土话；同源语；行话；个人用语特征

sentences.english: the local dialect
sentences.chinese: 当地方言

detailed_translations.chinese: 方言，土话；同源语；行话；个人用语特征
detailed_translations.english: a form of a language which is spoken only in one area, with words or grammar that are slightly different from other forms of the same language

name: ancestry
trans: n. 祖先；血统

sentences.english: Most people of European or African ancestry have the "wet" kind: thick and sticky.
sentences.chinese: 大多数欧洲或者非洲血统的人耳垢是湿的，厚的，有粘性的。

sentences.english: Martin has shown that, of the eukaryotic genes whose ancestry can be traced, 75 per cent or more came from bacteria rather than the host cell.
sentences.chinese: 马丁揭示，在哪些可以追溯到祖先的线粒体基因上，有75%或更多的成分来自当时外来的细菌而非宿主细胞。

sentences.english: You can only explain this by evolutionary common ancestry.
sentences.chinese: 你只能通过存在“进化上的共同祖先”来解释。

detailed_translations.english: the members of your family who lived a long time ago

name: complementary
trans: adj. 补足的，补充的

sentences.english: The computer and the human mind have different but complementary abilities.
sentences.chinese: 电脑与人脑各不相同，却又互为补充。

detailed_translations.english: complementary things go well together, although they are usually different

name: underneath
trans: prep. 在…的下面；在…的形式下；在…的支配下

sentences.english: He got out of the car and looked underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他下车往底下看了看。

sentences.english: It’s near where the railway goes underneath the road.
sentences.chinese: 它靠近铁路从公路下方穿过的地方。

sentences.english: She was wearing a smart jacket with a T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 她穿了件时髦的夹克，里面是一件 T 恤衫。

sentences.english: Her blonde hair was hidden underneath a baseball cap.
sentences.chinese: 一顶棒球帽裹住了她的满头金发。

sentences.english: He has on his jeans and a long-sleeved blue denim shirt with a white T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他身穿牛仔裤和一件蓝色长袖粗斜纹棉布衬衫，里面还有件白色T恤衫。

sentences.english: The shooting-range is lit from underneath by rows of ruby-red light fixtures.
sentences.chinese: 射击场被一排排宝石红照明装置从下面照亮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…的下面；在…的形式下；在…的支配下
detailed_translations.english: directly under another object or covered by it
Underneath is also an adverb
the bottom surface of something, or the part of something that is below or under something else

name: pathological
trans: adj. 病理学的；病态的；由疾病引起的（等于pathologic）

sentences.english: a pathological hatred of women
sentences.chinese: 对女人的病态憎恨

sentences.english: a pathological liar
sentences.chinese: 病态说谎者

detailed_translations.chinese: 病态的， 不理智的； 病理学的
detailed_translations.english: pathological behaviour or feelings happen regularly, and are strong, unreasonable, and impossible to control

name: proponent
trans: n. 支持者；建议者；提出认证遗嘱者

sentences.english: Halsey was identified as a leading proponent of the values of progressive education.
sentences.chinese: 哈尔西被认为是进步教育价值观的首要支持者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持者；建议者；提出认证遗嘱者
detailed_translations.english: someone who supports something or persuades people to do something

name: accomplishment
trans: n. 成就；完成；技艺，技能

sentences.english: It was a major accomplishment for a player who had been injured so recently.
sentences.chinese: 对于一个刚受过伤的选手来说，这是很好的成绩。

detailed_translations.english: something successful or impressive that is achieved after a lot of effort and hard work

name: illustrious
trans: adj. 著名的，杰出的；辉煌的

sentences.english: She has had an illustrious career.
sentences.chinese: 她已经有了辉煌的事业。

sentences.english: Wagner was just one of many illustrious visitors to the town.
sentences.chinese: 瓦格纳只是到访过这座小镇的众多名人中的一位。

detailed_translations.english: famous and admired because of what you have achieved

name: execution
trans: n. 执行，实行；完成；死刑

sentences.english: a public execution
sentences.chinese: 当众处死

sentences.english: The two men face execution (= They will be killed as a punishment ).
sentences.chinese: 两名男子面临处决。

sentences.english: Torture and summary execution (= execution without a trial or any legal process ) are common.
sentences.chinese: 严刑拷打和不经审判就地处决相当普遍。

sentences.english: He was granted a stay of execution (= delay in carrying out an execution ).
sentences.chinese: 他被准予缓期处决。

detailed_translations.chinese: 死刑； 实行， 执行， 履行； 演奏， 表演
detailed_translations.english: when someone is killed, especially as a legal punishment

name: patent
trans: n. 专利权；执照；专利品

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

name: dull
trans: adj. 钝的；迟钝的；无趣的；呆滞的；阴暗的

sentences.english: Life is never dull when Elizabeth is here.
sentences.chinese: 有伊丽莎白在这里生活绝不会无聊。

sentences.english: a dull movie
sentences.chinese: 一部沉闷的电影

sentences.english: It sounded pretty dull to me.
sentences.chinese: 在我听来，这很无聊。

sentences.english: The weekly meeting tends to be deadly dull (= very dull ) .
sentences.chinese: 每周一次的会议总是十分无聊。

sentences.english: The bird is dull brown and gray in colour.
sentences.chinese: 这只鸟是暗淡的棕灰色。

detailed_translations.english: not interesting or exciting

name: variation
trans: n. 变化；[生物] 变异，变种

sentences.english: Most of his poems are variations on the theme of love.
sentences.chinese: 他的大部分诗作都是有关爱情主题的形式不同的作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变化；[生物] 变异，变种
detailed_translations.english: a difference between similar things, or a change from the usual amount or form of something

name: terrain
trans: n. [地理] 地形，地势；领域；地带

sentences.english: rocky terrain
sentences.chinese: 多石的地形

detailed_translations.chinese: [地理] 地形，地势；领域；地带
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of land

name: stitch
trans: n. 针脚，线迹；一针

sentences.english: He had to have ten stitches in his head.
sentences.chinese: 他头上不得不缝了十针。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of thread that has been sewn into a piece of cloth, or the action of the thread going into and out of the cloth
to sew two pieces of cloth together, or to sew a decoration onto a piece of cloth

name: utilize
trans: vt. 利用

sentences.english: We must consider how best to utilize what resources we have.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须考虑怎样充分利用现有的资源。

detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose

name: simultaneously
trans: adv. 同时地

sentences.english: If they have multiple test cases that will be run on the same platforms, they can select multiple configurations simultaneously and apply the configurations to several of them in batch mode.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们拥有多个将要运行在同一个平台上的测试用例的话，那么他们能够同时选择多个配置，并且将这些配置批量应用到平台上。

name: innovator
trans: n. 改革者，创新者

sentences.english: He is an innovator in this field.
sentences.chinese: 他是这个领域的革新者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who introduces changes and new ideas

name: stellar
trans: adj. 星的；星球的；主要的；一流的

sentences.english: the company’s stellar growth
sentences.chinese: 这家公司辉煌的发展

detailed_translations.chinese: 星的；星球的；主要的；一流的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the stars

name: aggression
trans: n. 侵略；进攻；侵犯；侵害

sentences.english: an unprovoked act of aggression
sentences.chinese: 无端的侵犯

detailed_translations.english: the act of attacking a country, especially when that country has not attacked first

name: persistent
trans: adj. 固执的，坚持的；持久稳固的

sentences.english: persistent rumours
sentences.chinese: 持续流传的谣言

sentences.english: persistent headaches
sentences.chinese: 持续头疼

sentences.english: a persistent problem
sentences.chinese: 长期问题

sentences.english: persistent rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist or happen, especially for longer than is usual or desirable

name: deliberately
trans: adv. 故意地；谨慎地；慎重地

sentences.english: He deliberately upset her.
sentences.chinese: 他故意惹她不开心。

sentences.english: He shook his head slowly and deliberately.
sentences.chinese: 他缓缓而慎重地摇摇头。

detailed_translations.english: done in a way that is intended or planned

name: offset
trans: n. 抵消，补偿；平版印刷；支管

sentences.english: He was able to offset his travel expenses against tax.
sentences.chinese: 他可以用旅费抵税。

sentences.english: What expenses can you offset against tax ?
sentences.chinese: 什么开支可以获得税项减免？

detailed_translations.english: to use one cost, payment or situation in order to cancel or reduce the effect of another

name: idyllic
trans: 牧歌的

sentences.english: This idyllic pastoral scene is only part of the picture.
sentences.chinese: 但这种田园诗般的乡村风光仅仅是一个侧面。

sentences.english: Some believe that lemurians were much more like early humans living in a sort of idyllic paradise largely agrarian with lush forests and an abundance of flowers and fruit trees.
sentences.chinese: 一些就相信利莫里亚更加像早期的人类，生活在一种田园诗般的天堂里，主要地与繁荣的森林，盛开的花朵和结果的树在一起。

sentences.english: I don't mind a bit of idiosyncrasy, but that strange ideology you believe in , coupled with your idyllic ideas on life, suggest to me that all you're doing is looking for some idol to follow.
sentences.chinese: 你有一点特殊的癖性我不在乎，但你相信的那种奇怪的意识形态，加上你向往田园诗般生活的想法，给我的印象是你在做的就是要找到一个偶像来效仿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 田园诗般的， 田园风光的， 牧歌的

name: proverb
trans: n. 谚语，格言；众所周知的人或事

sentences.english: An old Arab proverb says, "The enemy of my enemy is my friend."
sentences.chinese: 有一句古老的阿拉伯谚语说：“我敌人的敌人是我的朋友。”

detailed_translations.english: a short well-known statement that gives advice or expresses something that is generally true. ‘A penny saved is a penny earned’ is an example of a proverb.

name: drone
trans: n. 雄蜂；嗡嗡的声音；懒惰者

sentences.english: An airplane droned overhead.
sentences.chinese: 一架飞机在头顶上轰鸣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雄蜂；嗡嗡的声音；懒惰者
detailed_translations.english: a continuous low dull sound
to make a continuous low dull sound

name: distrust
trans: n. 不信任

sentences.english: She had every reason to distrust him.
sentences.chinese: 她完全有理由不信任他。

detailed_translations.english: to not trust someone or something
a feeling that you cannot trust someone

name: covet
trans: vt. 垂涎；觊觎

sentences.english: The Michelin Awards are coveted by restaurants all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 米其林评级是全世界所有餐厅的渴望。

detailed_translations.english: to have a very strong desire to have something that someone else has

name: salvage
trans: n. 打捞；海上救助；抢救财货；救难的奖金

sentences.english: a massive salvage operation
sentences.chinese: 大规模的抢救行动

detailed_translations.chinese: 打捞；海上救助；抢救财货；救难的奖金
detailed_translations.english: when you save things from a situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost
to save something from an accident or bad situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost

name: watercolor
trans: n. 水彩画，水彩；水彩颜料

sentences.english: My uncle did a beautiful watercolor of a sunset while in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 我的叔叔在墨西哥时画了一幅漂亮的日落水彩画。

sentences.english: Instead, she started to examine the kitchen carefully, evaluating each watercolor on the wall, each shelf, the spice box, the plants, the pots.
sentences.chinese: 相反，她开始仔细检查厨房，评估每一种水彩，墙上的，架子上的，调味品盒子上的，植物的，以及锅上的。

name: overfish
trans: vt. 对（鱼、渔场）捕捞过度

sentences.english: But humans can help too, if we just learn to overfish the lionfish.
sentences.chinese: 但只要我们学习过度捕捞的狮子鱼，人类就能够有所帮助。

name: collaborative
trans: adj. 合作的，协作的

sentences.english: ...a collaborative research project.
sentences.chinese: …一个合作研究项目。

detailed_translations.english: a job or piece of work that involves two or more people working together to achieve something

name: emission
trans: n. （光、热等的）发射，散发；喷射；发行

sentences.english: the emission of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere
sentences.chinese: 向大气排放二氧化碳

sentences.english: Britain agreed to cut emissions of nitrogen oxide from power stations.
sentences.chinese: 英国同意减少发电站氮氧化物的排放量。

detailed_translations.english: the production or sending out of light, heat, gas, etc.

name: statue
trans: n. 雕像，塑像

sentences.english: Churchill’s statue stands outside the parliament building.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔的塑像矗立在议会大厦外。

sentences.english: A bronze statue was erected in his honour.
sentences.chinese: 人们立了一座铜像纪念他。

detailed_translations.english: an image of a person or animal that is made in solid material such as stone or metal and is usually large

name: altitude
trans: n. 高地；高度；[数] 顶垂线；（等级和地位等的）高级；海拔

sentences.english: The aircraft had reached its cruising altitude of about 39,000 feet.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机已经达到了大约三万九千英尺的巡航高度。

detailed_translations.english: the height of an object or place above the sea

name: knit
trans: vi. 编织；结合；皱眉

sentences.english: My grandmother taught me how to knit.
sentences.chinese: 我祖母教过我编织。

sentences.english: She’s knitting a sweater.
sentences.chinese: 她在织毛衣。

detailed_translations.english: to make clothing out of wool, using two knitting needles

name: sustainable
trans: adj. 可以忍受的；足可支撑的；养得起的；可持续的

sentences.english: The government should do more to promote sustainable agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 政府应该做更多工作来推动可持续农业的发展。

sentences.english: the sustainable use of rainforest resources
sentences.chinese: 雨林资源的可持续利用

sentences.english: Cycling is a totally sustainable form of transport.
sentences.chinese: 骑自行车是一种绝对环保的交通方式。

sentences.english: environmentally sustainable development
sentences.chinese: 生态环境的可持续发展

detailed_translations.english: able to continue without causing damage to the environment

name: universally
trans: adv. 普遍地；人人；到处

sentences.english: ...a universally accepted point of view.
sentences.chinese: …一个被普遍接受的观点。

detailed_translations.english: by everyone

name: radiation
trans: n. 辐射；发光；放射物

sentences.english: An accident at the power station could result in large amounts of radiation being released.
sentences.chinese: 发电站事故会造成大量核辐射泄漏。

sentences.english: a lethal dose of radiation
sentences.chinese: 致命剂量的辐射

sentences.english: Sun creams work by blocking harmful ultraviolet radiation.
sentences.chinese: 防晒霜可隔离有害的紫外线辐射。

detailed_translations.english: a form of energy that comes especially from nuclear reactions, which in large amounts is very harmful to living things

name: pendulum
trans: n. 钟摆；摇锤；摇摆不定的事态

sentences.english: The political pendulum has swung in favour of the liberals.
sentences.chinese: 政治的钟摆已经摆向了自由派。

detailed_translations.english: a long metal stick with a weight at the bottom that swings regularly from side to side to control the working of a clock

name: complicate
trans: vt. 使复杂化；使恶化；使卷入

sentences.english: I think that is because we unnecessarily complicate it.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是因为我们不必要地将生活复杂化了。

sentences.english: If the answer to all of these questions is no, a framework will only complicate matters.
sentences.chinese: 如果所有这些问题的答案都为否，那么使用框架只会把事情变复杂。

sentences.english: The selection service is one of the more difficult services to implement correctly because it has some valuable features that complicate the implementation.
sentences.chinese: 选择服务是比较难以正确实现的服务之一，因为它具有一些使实现复杂化的有价值的功能。

name: horrify
trans: vt. 使恐惧；惊骇；使极度厌恶

sentences.english: His family was horrified by the change.
sentences.chinese: 他的家人对这一变化感到震惊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使恐惧；惊骇；使极度厌恶
detailed_translations.english: If someone is horrified, they feel shocked or disgusted, usually because of something that they have seen or heard

name: superstition
trans: n. 迷信

sentences.english: the old superstition that walking under a ladder is unlucky
sentences.chinese: 认为从梯子下面穿过不吉利的古老迷信

detailed_translations.english: a belief that some objects or actions are lucky or unlucky, or that they cause events to happen, based on old ideas of magic

name: migration
trans: n. 迁移；移民；移动

sentences.english: What does this migration not do?
sentences.chinese: 这种迁移不能做什么？

sentences.english: Because of this and other differences in the two versions, we recommend that you test the maps after migration.
sentences.chinese: 由于这两个版本之间的种种差异，我们建议您在完成迁移后对映射进行测试。

detailed_translations.english: when large numbers of people go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: prey
trans: n. 捕食；牺牲者；被捕食的动物

sentences.english: a tiger stalking its prey
sentences.chinese: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

sentences.english: Cats prey on birds and mice.
sentences.chinese: 猫捕食鸟和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
(of an animal or a bird) to hunt and kill another animal for food

name: surpass
trans: vt. 超越；胜过，优于；非…所能办到或理解

sentences.english: He had surpassed all our expectations .
sentences.chinese: 他超越了我们所有的预期。

sentences.english: The number of multiple births has surpassed 100,000 for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 多胎产首次突破了 10 万例。

detailed_translations.english: to be even better or greater than someone or something else

name: venus
trans: 金星

detailed_translations.english: the Roman goddess of love

name: fret
trans: n. 烦躁；焦急；磨损

sentences.english: Don’t fret – everything will be all right.
sentences.chinese: 别担心——一切都会好的。

detailed_translations.english: to worry about something, especially when there is no need

name: deviance
trans: n. 异常；异常行为

name: proficiency
trans: n. 精通，熟练

sentences.english: I brought her proficiency up to the required level.
sentences.chinese: 我把她的熟练程度提高到所规定的水平。

sentences.english: With study and practice, almost anyone can do it with some level of proficiency, but most people don't learn how to think critically or analytically—nor are they even aware of its value.
sentences.chinese: 通过学习和实践，几乎任何人都能以不同的熟练程度来掌握它，但是大多数人都不会去学习如何进行批判性或分析性思维，或者说，他们根本意识不到其价值。

sentences.english: How do you think of your proficiency in written and spoken English?
sentences.chinese: 你认为你的书面 英语和 口语熟练程度如何？

detailed_translations.english: a good standard of ability and skill

name: respondent
trans: n. [法] 被告；应答者

sentences.english: Upon receipt of a copy of the arbitration application, the respondent shall, within the time limit prescribed by the Arbitration Rules, submit its defence to the arbitration commission.
sentences.chinese: 被申请人收到仲裁申请书副本后，应当在仲裁规则规定的期限内向仲裁委员会提交答辩书。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has to defend their own case in a law court, especially in a  divorce  case

name: apocalyptic
trans: adj. 启示录的；天启的

name: frontier
trans: n. 前沿；边界；国境

sentences.english: Lille is close to the frontier between France and Belgium.
sentences.chinese: 里尔靠近法比边境。

detailed_translations.english: the border of a country

name: optimize
trans: vt. 使最优化，使完善

sentences.english: They need to optimize the use of available resources.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要充分利用手上的资源。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the way that something is done or used so that it is as effective as possible

name: interpretation
trans: n. 解释；翻译；演出

sentences.english: One possible interpretation is that they want you to resign.
sentences.chinese: 一种可能的解释是，他们想要你辞职。

sentences.english: It’s difficult to put an accurate interpretation on (= explain ) the survey results.
sentences.chinese: 对调查结果难以作出确切的解释。

sentences.english: What exactly the author meant by that statement is open to interpretation (= able to be understood or explained in different ways ).
sentences.chinese: 作者这句话的确切含义可有各种理解。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which someone explains or understands an event, information, someone’s actions etc

name: aspiration
trans: n. 渴望；抱负；送气；吸气；吸引术

sentences.english: a high level of political aspiration
sentences.chinese: 崇高的政治抱负

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈的愿望； 志向， 抱负
detailed_translations.english: a strong desire to have or achieve something

name: pus
trans: n. 脓；脓汁

name: bind
trans: n. 捆绑；困境；讨厌的事情；植物的藤蔓

sentences.english: The monks are bound by vows of silence.
sentences.chinese: 僧侣们必须遵守保持缄默的誓言。

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合；装订；有约束力；过紧
detailed_translations.english: if you are bound by an agreement, promise etc, you must do what you have agreed to do or promised to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 捆绑；困境；讨厌的事情；植物的藤蔓
detailed_translations.english: an annoying or difficult situation

name: non-attendance
trans: 不出席

name: seemingly
trans: adv. 看来似乎；表面上看来

sentences.english: seemingly unrelated bits of information
sentences.chinese: 似乎互不相关的零星信息

detailed_translations.english: appearing to have a particular quality, when this may or may not be true

name: precise
trans: adj. 精确的；明确的；严格的

sentences.english: precise sales figures
sentences.chinese: 准确的销售数据

sentences.english: It was difficult to get precise information.
sentences.chinese: 很难得到确切的消息。

sentences.english: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
sentences.chinese: “她比你大很多，是不是？”“准确地说，大了15岁。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 精确的， 准确的； 严谨的
detailed_translations.english: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

name: evaporate
trans: vt. 使……蒸发；使……脱水；使……消失

sentences.english: Most of the water had evaporated.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

name: folklore
trans: n. 民俗学；民间传说；民间风俗

sentences.english: In Chinese folklore the bat is a symbol of good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 在中国民间传说中，蝙蝠是好运的象征。

detailed_translations.chinese: 民俗学；民间传说；民间风俗
detailed_translations.english: the traditional stories, customs etc of a particular area or country

name: redact
trans: 修订

name: random
trans: n. 随意

sentences.english: The gang picked their victims at random.
sentences.chinese: 这帮犯罪分子随意选择对象下手。

sentences.english: The company has introduced random drug testing of its employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司已实行对雇员的随机毒品测试。

detailed_translations.english: without any definite plan, aim, or pattern
happening or chosen without any definite plan, aim, or pattern

name: cosmetic
trans: n. 化妆品；装饰品

sentences.english: the cosmetic industry
sentences.chinese: 化妆品行业

sentences.english: cosmetic products
sentences.chinese: 美容产品

sentences.english: Are you on the diet for health or cosmetic reasons?
sentences.chinese: 你节食是为了健康还是为了美丽？

sentences.english: ...the cosmetics counter of a department store.
sentences.chinese: …一个百货商店的化妆品专柜。

detailed_translations.english: intended to make your hair, skin, body etc look more attractive
Cosmetics are substances such as lipstick or powder, which people put on their face to make themselves look more attractive

name: charm
trans: n. 魅力，吸引力；魔力

sentences.english: Joe’s boyish charm
sentences.chinese: 乔身上的稚趣

sentences.english: She turned on the charm (= used her charm ) to all the men.
sentences.chinese: 她对所有那些男人都施展魅力。

sentences.english: The room had no windows and all the charm of a prison cell (= used to say that something has no charm ) .
sentences.chinese: 这房间没有窗，简直就是牢房。

detailed_translations.english: a special quality someone or something has that makes people like them, feel attracted to them, or be easily influenced by them – used to show approval

name: tong
trans: n. 帮会，堂；钳子

name: awareness
trans: n. 意识，认识；明白，知道

sentences.english: Health officials have tried to raise awareness (=  improve people’s knowledge  ) about AIDS.
sentences.chinese: 卫生部官员努力提高人们对艾滋病的认识。

detailed_translations.english: knowledge or understanding of a particular subject or situation

name: encroachment
trans: n. 侵入，侵犯；侵蚀

sentences.english: It's a sign of the encroachment of commercialism in medicine.
sentences.chinese: 这是营利主义入侵医学界的一种迹象。

detailed_translations.english: You can describe the action or process of encroaching on something as encroachment

name: asteroid
trans: n. [天] 小行星；[无脊椎] 海盘车；小游星

sentences.english: Astronomers have detected an asteroid not far from Earth, moving in the same orbit around the Sun.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家在距离地球不远处发现一颗与地球绕日轨道相同的小行星。

sentences.english: Look at the movies that we see all the time. It's easy to imagine the end of the world. An asteroid destroying all life and so on.
sentences.chinese: 瞧瞧那些我们一直在看的电影，要想像世界末日那是很容易的事，比如一个小行星毁灭了所有生命之类的。

sentences.english: Moving on through the asteroid belt we enter the realms of the gas giant planets: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune, all of which dwarf the Earth.
sentences.chinese: 穿过小行星带继续前进，我们进入了气体巨行星区域：木星、土星、天王星、海王星，所有这些都使地球看起来像个侏儒。

detailed_translations.english: one of the many small  planet s  that move around the Sun, especially between Mars and Jupiter

name: hamstring
trans: n. 腿筋

sentences.english: Meanwhile, work on strengthening and stretching your hip, hamstring and lower-back muscles.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时还要拉伸和增强你臀部、腿筋和腰背部的肌肉。

sentences.english: Far more telling was the correlation between the various runners’ tight or loose hamstring muscles and their running economy, a measure of how much oxygen they used while striding.
sentences.chinese: 进一步讲，不同跑步者腿筋肌的松紧和步伐频率是有联系的，这是一种对他们在跨步行进时耗氧量的评估。

sentences.english: For stretching, focus on the hamstring stretch, the hip &lower-back stretch, and the hamstring &back stretch.
sentences.chinese: 拉伸方面——特别要关注腿筋拉伸、髋关节和腰背部拉伸、腿筋和背部锻炼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 切断腿筋使成跛腿；使残废

name: institutionalize
trans: vt. 使…制度化

sentences.english: the struggle to institutionalize equality for women
sentences.chinese: 使妇女平等制度化的斗争

detailed_translations.english: to make something a normal, accepted part of a social system or organization

name: locust
trans: n. [植保] 蝗虫，[昆] 蚱蜢

sentences.english: a swarm of locusts
sentences.chinese: 一大群蝗虫

detailed_translations.english: an insect that lives mainly in Asia and Africa and flies in a very large group, eating and destroying crops

name: interspecific
trans: adj. 种类间的

name: smallpox
trans: n. [内科] 天花

name: logarithmic
trans: 对数

name: flourish
trans: n. 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

name: illustration
trans: n. 说明；插图；例证；图解

sentences.english: The book contains 62 pages of illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 这本书有62页插图。

detailed_translations.english: a picture in a book, article etc, especially one that helps you to understand it

name: onset
trans: n. 开始，着手；发作；攻击，进攻

sentences.english: the onset of winter
sentences.chinese: 冬天的来临

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始，着手；发作；攻击，进攻
detailed_translations.english: the beginning of something, especially something bad

name: prospective
trans: n. 预期；展望

sentences.english: The story should act as a warning to other prospective buyers.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报道应该可以对其他可能的购买者起到警告作用。

detailed_translations.english: You use prospective to describe someone who wants to be the thing mentioned or who is likely to be the thing mentioned

name: torturous
trans: adj. 折磨人的，痛苦的

sentences.english: a torturous five days of fitness testing
sentences.chinese: 五天痛苦的体能测试

detailed_translations.english: very painful or unpleasant to experience

name: longitude
trans: n. [地理] 经度；经线

sentences.english: The town lies at longitude 12˚ east.
sentences.chinese: 这个镇位于东经12度。

detailed_translations.english: the distance east or west of a particular  meridian (= imaginary line along the Earth’s surface from the North Pole to the South Pole )  , measured in degrees

name: vulnerability
trans: n. 易损性；弱点

sentences.english: Now that we know the basis of an attack, what can we do to protect ourselves from this vulnerability?
sentences.chinese: 既然我们知道了攻击的基本知识，那么做些什么才能保护我们自己避免这一脆弱性呢？

sentences.english: But you also notice the sense of limitation and the vulnerability associated with the physical state of virginity here.
sentences.chinese: 但是你们也要注意到限制和弱点的意义所在,那是与身体的贞节状态相联系的。

sentences.english: This points to another vulnerability.
sentences.chinese: 这指的是另一弱点。

name: skeptical
trans: adj. 怀疑的；怀疑论的，不可知论的

sentences.english: So how do we strengthen our skeptical skills?
sentences.chinese: 那么，我们如何加强自身的怀疑技能呢？

sentences.english: Not all theory that we read in this course is skeptical.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这门课中提及的理论不全是怀疑性的。

sentences.english: L.M.:Well, I was skeptical myself in the beginning. But these are facts. The findings are very reproducible and we are waiting for confirmation by other labs.
sentences.chinese: 大爷：我老人家一开始也是很怀疑的。但是这个是事实。这个发现可以被反复验证，我们正在等待别的实验是的验证。

name: resemble
trans: vt. 类似，像

sentences.english: It’s amazing how closely Brian and Steve resemble each other.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩和史蒂夫真是惊人地相像。

sentences.english: He grew up to resemble his father.
sentences.chinese: 他长大了，很像他父亲。

detailed_translations.english: to look like or be similar to someone or something

name: squirt
trans: n. 喷射；注射

sentences.english: Some kids squirted a water pistol in her face.
sentences.chinese: 有几个小孩用水枪朝她脸上喷水。

sentences.english: It just needs a little squirt of oil.
sentences.chinese: 它只需喷点油。

detailed_translations.english: if you squirt liquid or if it squirts somewhere, it is forced out in a thin fast stream

detailed_translations.chinese: 喷射； 〈口， 贬〉无名小辈
detailed_translations.english: Squirt is also a noun

name: medieval
trans: adj. 中世纪的；原始的；仿中世纪的；老式的

sentences.english: These spices were first brought to Italy from the East in medieval times.
sentences.chinese: 这些香料最早是在中世纪时从东方被带到了意大利。

sentences.english: a medieval castle
sentences.chinese: 一座中世纪城堡

detailed_translations.english: connected with the Middle Ages (= the period between about 1100 and 1500 AD )

name: amenity
trans: n. 舒适；礼仪；愉快；便利设施

sentences.english: The hotel is in the city centre, close to shops and local amenities.
sentences.chinese: 该酒店位于市中心，紧邻商店和当地的便利设施。

sentences.english: houses that lack basic amenities
sentences.chinese: 缺乏基本生活设施的房屋

detailed_translations.chinese: 舒适；礼仪；愉快；便利设施
detailed_translations.english: something that makes a place comfortable or easy to live in

name: elevation
trans: n. 高地；海拔；提高；崇高；正面图

sentences.english: The city is at an elevation of 2 000 metres.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市海拔2000米。

detailed_translations.english: the height of a place, especially its height above sea level

name: willow
trans: n. [林] 柳树；[木] 柳木制品

sentences.english: The willow trees cast their shadows all around.
sentences.chinese: 柳荫匝地。

sentences.english: He worships that big willow south of the house.
sentences.chinese: 他很崇拜房子南面的那颗大柳树。

sentences.english: He has also captured pollen from alder, pine and willow.
sentences.chinese: 他还从桤树、松树和柳树上捕捉到了花粉。

detailed_translations.english: a type of tree that has long thin branches and grows near water, or the wood from this tree

name: boarding school
trans: n. 寄宿学校

sentences.english: She and her brother are both at boarding school.
sentences.chinese: 她和她弟弟都在寄宿学校念书。

sentences.english: "It was school, " she said. "I went to a boarding school.
sentences.chinese: “都是学校做的好事”，她说，“我去了一所寄宿学校。

sentences.english: I can stand Janet now. She and her brother are both at boarding school.
sentences.chinese: 维罗尼卡说，“我现在能受得了珍妮特，她兄妹两都在寄宿学校。”

detailed_translations.english: a school where students live as well as study

name: demolish
trans: vt. 拆除；破坏；毁坏；推翻；驳倒

sentences.english: The entire east wing of the building was demolished in the fire.
sentences.chinese: 大楼的整个东翼都被大火烧毁了。

detailed_translations.english: to completely destroy a building

name: unconventional
trans: adj. 非常规的；非传统的；不依惯例的

sentences.english: Linus Pauling is an unconventional genius.
sentences.chinese: 莱纳斯·鲍林是个奇才。

sentences.english: He was known for his unconventional behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他曾因另类行为而出名。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非传统的, 不合惯例的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their attitude or behaviour as unconventional, you mean that they do not behave in the same way as most other people in their society

name: spectacle
trans: n. 景象；场面；奇观；壮观；公开展示；表相，假相 n.（复）眼镜

sentences.english: a multimedia dance and opera spectacle
sentences.chinese: 盛大的多媒体舞蹈戏剧表演

sentences.english: The trial was turned into a public spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 审判变成了一场公开的闹剧。

detailed_translations.english: a very impressive show or scene

name: equitable
trans: adj. 公平的，公正的；平衡法的

sentences.english: an equitable distribution of food supplies
sentences.chinese: 所供应食品的合理分配

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平的，公正的；平衡法的
detailed_translations.english: treating all people in a fair and equal way

name: longhaul
trans: 长途的

name: probability
trans: n. 可能性；机率；[数] 或然率

sentences.english: You must decide whether, on the balance of probabilities , he committed the crime.
sentences.chinese: 你们一定要权衡正反两方面的可能性，然后再裁定他是否犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: how likely something is, sometimes calculated in a mathematical way

name: globalization
trans: n. 全球化

sentences.english: the increasing globalization of world trade
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易的日益全球化

detailed_translations.english: the process of making something such as a business operate in a lot of different countries all around the world, or the result of this

name: relatively
trans: adv. 相当地；相对地，比较地

sentences.english: The system is relatively easy to use.
sentences.chinese: 这个系统使用起来相对容易。

sentences.english: E-commerce is a relatively recent phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 电子商务相对而言是新兴事物。

detailed_translations.english: something that is relatively small, easy etc is fairly small, easy etc compared to other things

name: secular
trans: n. 修道院外的教士，(对宗教家而言的) 俗人

sentences.english: secular education
sentences.chinese: 世俗教育

sentences.english: our modern secular society
sentences.chinese: 我们的现代世俗社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的；长期的；现世的；不朽的
detailed_translations.english: not connected with or controlled by a church or other religious authority

detailed_translations.chinese: 修道院外的教士，(对宗教家而言的) 俗人

name: spew
trans: vt. 喷出；呕吐

sentences.english: Factory chimneys spewed fumes out into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 工厂的烟囱向空中喷吐浓烟。

detailed_translations.english: to flow out of something quickly in large quantities, or to make something flow out in this way

name: Termite
trans: 白蚁

name: derive
trans: vt. 源于；得自；获得

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

trans: vt. 使动摇；使不安定；使心神不宁

sentences.english: The sudden changes unsettled Judy.
sentences.chinese: 突如其来的变化弄得朱迪心神不宁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使动摇；使不安定；使心神不宁
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel slightly nervous, worried, or upset

name: platinum
trans: n. [化学] 铂；白金；唱片集达100万张的销售量；银灰色

sentences.english: a platinum ring
sentences.chinese: 白金戒指

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 铂；白金；唱片集达100万张的销售量；银灰色
detailed_translations.english: a silver-grey metal that does not change colour or lose its brightness, and is used in making expensive jewellery and in indus-try. It is a chemical element: symbol Pt

name: seduce
trans: vt. 引诱；诱惑；诱奸；怂恿

sentences.english: The head lecturer was sacked for seducing female students.
sentences.chinese: 这个首席讲师因诱奸女学生而被解雇。

sentences.english: Are you trying to seduce me?
sentences.chinese: 你是在勾引我吗？

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to have sex with you, especially in a way that is attractive and not too direct

name: repaint
trans: n. 重新油漆的东西；重画的画

sentences.english: They hired a small company to repaint the dining room.
sentences.chinese: 他们雇用一个小公司重新油漆饭厅。

detailed_translations.english: to apply a new or fresh coat of paint

name: tidal
trans: adj. 潮汐的；潮的，有关潮水的；定时涨落的

sentences.english: tidal currents
sentences.chinese: 潮流

detailed_translations.chinese: 潮汐的；潮的，有关潮水的；定时涨落的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the regular rising and falling of the sea

name: linear
trans: adj. 线的，线型的；直线的，线状的；长度的

sentences.english: a linear diagram
sentences.chinese: 线形图

sentences.english: linear measurements
sentences.chinese: 长度量度

detailed_translations.english: consisting of lines, or in the form of a straight line

name: atheistic
trans: adj. 无神论的；无神论者的

name: baseline
trans: n. 基线；底线

name: legitimate
trans: adj. 合法的；正当的；合理的；正统的

sentences.english: So all of this is a legitimate source of concern.
sentences.chinese: 因此，这些情况都是引发忧虑的合理根源。

sentences.english: Even though I had legitimate reasons ( bullshit ). You know I have to make them dividends ( bullshit ).
sentences.chinese: 即使我有合法的理由（胡说）。你知道我必须支付利息（胡说）。

sentences.english: Often, as in this case, there is no intentional hoaxing: It is a legitimate, straightforward photograph of something curious.
sentences.chinese: 就像此事一样，它们通常都是无意的闹剧：这是某些稀奇的东西合法的、易懂的照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当的， 合理的； 合法的
detailed_translations.english: fair or reasonable

name: droplet
trans: n. 小滴，微滴

sentences.english: Droplets of sweat were welling up on his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 一颗颗小汗珠从他额头上不断冒出来。

detailed_translations.english: a very small drop of liquid

name: orbit
trans: n. 轨道；眼眶；势力范围；生活常规

sentences.english: Mars and Earth have orbits which change with time.
sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

detailed_translations.english: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

name: trickery
trans: n. 欺骗；诡计；奸计

sentences.english: No steel rods, no magnets, no computer trickery.
sentences.chinese: 那里没有钢条、没有磁铁也没有电脑欺骗。

sentences.english: But does not necessarily connote dishonesty, insincerity, or trickery.
sentences.chinese: 有可能——但是并不必然地——意味着不诚实， 不诚心或欺骗。

sentences.english: Yet there is no cheating involved in any of the photographs. No steel rods, no magnets, no computer trickery. The only glue he uses is Nature's. Gravity.
sentences.chinese: 然而，其中任何一张照片都没有涉及到欺骗。那里没有钢条、没有磁铁也没有电脑欺骗。他使用的唯一粘合剂是大自然的重力。

detailed_translations.english: the use of tricks to deceive or cheat people

name: rigor
trans: n. 严厉；精确；苛刻；僵硬

sentences.english: We are not so much testing as proposal-thinning, and we can add rigor such as traceability and other documentation as the leading architectural candidates emerge.
sentences.chinese: 我们不像细化提议那样做太多测试，随着最主要的架构候选的出现，我们可以添加严密，如可溯性和其他文档。

sentences.english: The towers, not only ground the buildings with their visual weight, but they also contribute to the rigor of rhythmic play needed in such expansive internal spaces and environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些塔楼不仅利用其视觉上的厚重感将建筑物固定在地面上，还有助于生成这种开阔的内部空间和环境所需的严谨的韵律感。

name: quarantine
trans: n. 检疫；隔离；检疫期；封锁

sentences.english: She was sent home and put in quarantine.
sentences.chinese: 她被送回家实施隔离。

detailed_translations.english: to keep a person or animal apart from others for a period of time in case they are carrying a disease
a period of time when a person or animal is kept apart from others in case they are carrying a disease

name: infrared
trans: n. 红外线

sentences.english: Both the model and the satellite sensor use infrared energy to measure clouds.
sentences.chinese: 模型和卫星传感器都使用红外能量来进行云的估算。

sentences.english: "This is an exciting result, " says Tinetti. "This is the first near-infrared spectrum of a planet.
sentences.chinese: 迪奈蒂说：“这是个令人兴奋的结果，这是行星上发现的第一个近红外光谱。

sentences.english: His discovery of the electromagnetic spectrum led to the development of television, radio, microwaves, as well as aiding in the development of radio and infrared telescopes.
sentences.chinese: 他发现的电磁特性最终导致电视、广播、微波炉的发明，并且也对无线电和红外望远镜的发明起到了重要作用。

detailed_translations.english: Infrared radiation is similar to light but has a longer wavelength, so we cannot see it without special equipment

name: entrepreneur
trans: n. 企业家；承包人；主办者

sentences.english: “You have to be an optimist to be an inventor or entrepreneur, ” he concludes.
sentences.chinese: 要成为一位发明家或企业家，你必须得是个乐天派。

sentences.english: If any of you end up being entrepreneur, which I hope you will be, what do you have in store for yourself, and what does that journey look like?
sentences.chinese: 如果你们当中任何一个人成了企业家，这也是我希望你们做到的，你自己会有什么样的储备，那样的一段旅程又将是什么样的？

sentences.english: How would you define personal growth as an entrepreneur?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何定义,一个企业家的个人成长？

detailed_translations.english: someone who starts a new business or arranges business deals in order to make money, often in a way that involves financial risks

name: deteriorate
trans: vi. 恶化，变坏

sentences.english: Ethel’s health has deteriorated.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞尔的健康状况恶化了。

sentences.english: America’s deteriorating economy
sentences.chinese: 美国日渐恶化的经济

detailed_translations.english: to become worse

name: illusive
trans: adj. 错觉的；幻影的；迷惑人的

sentences.english: He was fond of calling his detractor illiterate, denouncing his scientific theories as illegitimate and illusive.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢把他的恶意批评者称作文盲，公然抨击他的科学理论是非法的，迷惑人的。

name: curb
trans: n. 抑制；路边；勒马绳

sentences.english: measures to curb the spread of the virus
sentences.chinese: 控制病毒扩散的措施

detailed_translations.english: to control or limit something in order to prevent it from having a harmful effect

detailed_translations.chinese: 控制， 约束； 路缘
detailed_translations.english: an influence which helps to control or limit something

name: occupancy
trans: n. 居住；占有；占用

sentences.english: Hotels in Tokyo enjoy over 90% occupancy.
sentences.chinese: 东京的宾馆入住率高达90%以上。

detailed_translations.english: the number of people who stay, work, or live in a room or building at the same time

name: labour
trans: n. （英国）工党

sentences.english: The garage charges £30 an hour for labour.
sentences.chinese: 汽车修理厂收取每小时30英镑的人工费。

sentences.english: Many women do hard manual labour(= work with their hands ).
sentences.chinese: 许多妇女从事繁重的体力劳动。

sentences.english: Workers withdrew their labour (= protested by stopping work ) for twenty-four hours.
sentences.chinese: 工人罢工24小时。

sentences.english: a shortage of skilled labor
sentences.chinese: 熟练工人短缺

detailed_translations.english: work, especially physical work

name: proliferation
trans: n. 增殖，扩散；分芽繁殖

sentences.english: It is believed that it inhibits an enzyme that promotes cell proliferation in tumours.
sentences.chinese: 据信它能抑制一种能在肿瘤中促进细胞增殖的酶的生成。

sentences.english: "Brand proliferation is not a novelty, and it is profitable if you execute it well, " he says.
sentences.chinese: 他表示：“品牌扩散并不新鲜，如果执行得好，它是会带来盈利的。”

sentences.english: We do have differing perspectives on the problem, but we share an interest in reducing the violence, securing chemical weapons and ensuring they are neither used or are they subject to proliferation.
sentences.chinese: 我们确实在这个问题上有不同意见，但我们在减少暴力、获取化学武器和确保化学武器不被使用或扩散上拥有共同利益。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden increase in the amount or number of something

name: induce
trans: vt. 诱导；引起；引诱；感应

sentences.english: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.english: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说手术可能导致心脏病。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

name: burgeon
trans: vt. 萌芽, 发芽

sentences.english: When spring is coming all trees begin to burgeon .
sentences.chinese: 当春天到来的时候，所有树开始发芽。

sentences.english: The brain-drain effect of studying abroad has started to burgeon due to flaws in the domestic academic environment.
sentences.chinese: 由于国内学术环境恶劣，出国留学造成人才外流的现象已经初显萌芽。

sentences.english: The seed of friendship and cooperation we sow today will burgeon and harvest in the future and China-US partnership of cooperation will definitely enjoy a better tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天播下的友好合作种子一定能够生根发芽、开花结果，中美合作伙伴关系一定能够迎来更加美好的明天。

name: infinitely
trans: adv. 无限地；极其

sentences.english: Human beings are infinitely adaptable.
sentences.chinese: 人类的适应力是无限的。

detailed_translations.english: extremely; with no limit

name: proximity
trans: n. 接近，[数]邻近；接近；接近度，距离；亲近

sentences.english: Here the rich and the poor live in close proximity (= very near to each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 在这里，富人和穷人比邻而居。

detailed_translations.english: nearness in distance or time

name: outdoors
trans: adv. 在户外

sentences.english: It’s warm enough to eat outdoors tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚很暖和，可以在户外用餐。

sentences.english: He likes to work outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢在户外工作。

detailed_translations.english: outside, not in a building
the countryside far away from buildings and cities

name: dwell
trans: vi. 居住；存在于；细想某事

sentences.english: They dwelt in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在森林里。

sentences.english: So you made a mistake, but there's no need to dwell on it.
sentences.chinese: 你是错了，不过不必老是想着这事儿。

detailed_translations.english: to live in a particular place

name: enrol
trans: vi. 注册；参军

name: productive
trans: adj. 能生产的；生产的，生产性的；多产的；富有成效的

sentences.english: the economy’s productive capacity
sentences.chinese: 该经济体的生产能力

detailed_translations.english: relating to the production of goods, crops, or wealth

name: cyclone
trans: n. 旋风；[气象] 气旋；飓风

sentences.english: The race was called off as a cyclone struck.
sentences.chinese: 由于旋风袭击，比赛被取消了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 旋风；[气象] 气旋；飓风
detailed_translations.english: a very strong wind that moves very fast in a circle

name: strike a balance
trans: na. 结账；衡量得失

name: susceptible
trans: n. 易得病的人

sentences.english: A lot of TV advertising is aimed at susceptible young children.
sentences.chinese: 很多电视广告瞄准了易受影响的幼儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易受影响的； 过敏的； 能经受的， 容许的
detailed_translations.english: likely to suffer from a particular illness or be affected by a particular problem

name: symptomatic
trans: adj. 有症状的；症候的

sentences.english: These serve to show that children with mental disorders can not only be treated but can direct some of their symptomatic behavior into positive channels.
sentences.chinese: 做这些是为了告诉人们，精神疾病患儿不仅是可以治疗的，而且可以将一些症状行为引导到积极的方面上。

sentences.english: Across the board, parents rated honey as significantly better than DM or no treatment for symptomatic relief of their child’s nighttime cough and sleep difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 通过选举，家长将蜂蜜评为比右美沙芬或无治疗对于减缓孩子夜间咳嗽和睡眠困难症状更有效的东西。

sentences.english: The cooperation of residents is good, house-to-house surveillance for febrile illness is continuing, and specimens have been taken from symptomatic persons and sent for testing.
sentences.chinese: 居民的合作良好，正在继续开展对发热疾病的挨家挨户监测，并且已从有症状的人那里采集标本和送去检测。

detailed_translations.english: showing that someone has a particular illness
